loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items for his ready-made items business

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en:
Ryan T. is from the village of Brgy. Roxas,Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 21 years old. Ryan is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Ryan owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ryan has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per harvest, or every five months, for these activities.

In 2011, Ryan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ryan is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ryan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline B. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 57 years old. Evangeline is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Evangeline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 33000 PHP which will be used to purchase stock of products such as soap, condiments, canned goods and soft drinks. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Evangeline from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of products such as soap, condiments, canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella B. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old. Bella is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Bella owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, beverages, snack foods, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. She also butchers pigs for deliveries at houses for credit & also provides ice cubes for school canteen businesses. Bella has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Bella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bella is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and as working capital for her business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Bella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and provides working capital for her business.

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en:
Erwin is from the village of Malagana, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. He is 54 years old. Erwin is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Erwin owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, beverages, junk foods, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Erwin has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erwin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Erwin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Erwin is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Erwin from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages.

loans.name: Tessito Faraya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 18 juin 2002. Il est composé de 07 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et ont pratiquement la même ambition (le développement de leur terroir). Le petit commerce et la culture de patate douce est leur activité principale.

Madame Mouskéba qui est à la gauche de la photo levant la main est le responsable du groupe. elle est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants.

Elle s'active dans la vente de poisson frais et de nettétou. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine qu'elle pratique depuis plus d'une décennie.

Ce prêt lui permettra d'augmenter son capital et de mieux développer ses activités.

les profits lui permettront d'aider sa famille et ses enfants dans l'amélioration des conditions de vie(santé, nourriture etc...).
texts.en:
The solidarity group was created 18 June 2002. It consists of seven women living in the same neighborhood with virtually the same goal (to develop their land). Their main activities are small retail businesses and cultivating sweet potatoes.

Ms. Mouskéba - who is raising her hand on the left of the photo - is the group leader. She is 39 years old, married with three children.

She is active in the sale of fresh fish and nettétou (traditional West-African condiment). She has good experience in this field where she has been practicing for over a decade.

This loan will enable her to increase her capital and to further develop her activities.

The profits will enable her to help her family and her children by improving their living conditions (health, food, etc...).

loans.use: to buy fish and nettétou (traditional West-African condiment)

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Berna has a business selling fruits and vegetables, which she has run for one year.
To help expand her business, Berna has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Berna hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself – for example, by buying clothes. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and work in a big market.
Berna is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by generating more capital from her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene tiene 38 años reside en la localidad de Huaylahuicha. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora, vive en casa de su madre, quien le ayuda a cuidar de sus 2 queridos hijos, Joselin de 15 y Víctor de 12 años, a quienes quiere mucho. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, ahí trabaja arduamente, para que sus cultivos de lechuga, arveja, espinaca, cebollita china y papa, sean los más solicitados de su poblado. Todas las mañanas como hace 5 años; sin importar las condiciones del clima, sale a trabajar hacía sus chacras, ya que sabe que de ello dependen los ingresos que obtendrán por la venta de sus productos, que según cuenta tardan un promedio de 5 meses en madurar. Tiempo en que traslada su producción al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, para ser comercializado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, más le dificulta transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de la ciudad. Pero eso no la desanima, ya que traslada sus sembríos de espinaca a la capital donde obtiene mayores ganancias. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción y así obtener una camioneta con las ganancias que obtendrá. Todo esto pensando en el futuro de sus hijos, a quienes desea pagarles la carrera universitaria. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Victoria” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de la colaboración de todos ustedes para lograr sus objetivos. Con el compromiso de pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, por otro lado se siente feliz de pertenecer a una asociación que le ayude a crecer. Marlene de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semilla de arveja y varios sacos de abono orgánico para comenzar con la siembra.
texts.en:
Marlene, 38, lives in the town of Huaylahuicha.  She is a hard-working woman and lives with her mother who helps care for her two lovely children, Joselin, 15, and Víctor, 12, whom she loves very much.  Her main business is agriculture, and she works hard to grow lettuce, peas, spinach, Chinese onions and potatoes, which are in most demand in her town.  Every morning, as she has been doing for five years no matter what the weather conditions were, she goes out to work on her land because she knows her income depends on sales of her produce, which takes an average five months to grow.  She then takes it to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma to be sold.  

What she likes most about her job is working the lands.  The most difficult part is getting her produce to market.  But she does not let this get her down, and she takes her spinach crop to the capital city where she can earn more money.  In the future she would like to buy more land to increase production and buy a truck with her earnings.  Everything is all based on her children's future, as she would like to put them through college.  She belongs to the communal bank "Victoria" and this is her second loan through MFP, where she counts on your support to help her grow.  Marlene plans to use the loan to buy pea seeds and several sacks of organic fertilizer to begin planting.

loans.use: To buy pea seeds and several sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 2 Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas II se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a una de las miembros, quien contactó con una de las asesoras, para informarse sobre el programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando ya en el 3° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La Sra. Sixta se dedica a la venta de ropas, este trabajo la ha ayudado mucho a la hora de mantener su hogar, puesto que gracias a esto genera ingresos y le permite paliar los gastos que surgen. Ella manifiesta que todo el sacrificio que hace es por darle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia y a ella misma. Sueña con algún día tener un puesto donde exhibir sus ropas.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de ropas de invierno, ya que se viene la temporada de frió y quiere estar prevenida para lo que los clientes le soliciten.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Unidas II” (United Women II) is known as an excellent group of women from the city of Itá. Thanks to one of its members, who was contacted by one of the advisors, they learned about the Women Entrepreneurs Program. Once the group received the information, they were able to gather 17 women who are now working on their third loan cycle as part of the program.

Sra. Sixta sells clothing. This work has been a great help in maintaining her household. Thanks to the income she generates, Sixta is able to offset the expenses her family accumulates. She says that all of her sacrifice has enabled her and her family to live a better lifestyle. Sixta dreams of having a vending stall where she can display her merchandise.

She is requesting a loan to buy winter clothing since the weather is cold. Sixta wants to be prepared for whatever her customers may order.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing.

loans.name: Kangnigan

texts.fr:
Kangnigan  est âgée de 34ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse. Il est papa de trois(03) enfants.

 Il est revendeur de glaçons et de pure water depuis 2009.Il s’approvisionne à Lomé et revend à kangnikopé un quartier de la ville.

Il sollicite ce premier crédit à Wages afin d’acheter un nouveau congélateur. Il emploie une personne qui l’aide dans son commerce pour mieux satisfaire la clientèle.
texts.en:
Kangnigan is 34 years old. He is married to a saleswoman. He is the dad of three children.

He has been retailing ice and purified water since 2009. He gets his supplies from Lome and resells in Kangnikopé, one of the city's districts.

He is requesting this first loan from Wages to purchase a new freezer. He employs one person who helps him in his trade to better satisfy his clients.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang (pictured above), 57, is a widow without children. She is a tailor and she is hired to put together fabric swatches. She lives in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Neang is asking for a loan of $1,000 to rebuild the kitchen where she cooks because it’s old and breaks.

loans.use: To rebuild the kitchen where she cooks because it’s old and breaks.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a focused 44-year-old business woman. She is married and is blessed with 5 children. To make a living, she operates a grocery shop. She wants in the next 5 years to have moved into larger premises and to have tripled her turnover. She is requesting for a loan of 10000 Kenyan shillings to buy carrots, onions, tomatoes and bananas. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she can now save on a weekly basis.

loans.use: to buy carrots, onions, tomatoes and bananas

loans.name: Haidarboi

texts.ru:
Хайдарбой целеустремленный и честный человек. Более 6 лет он занимается купля продажей скот. Он начал свой бизнес с куплей продажей крупного рогатого скота и получил хороший прибыль. Приобретая грузовую автомашину, он начал заниматься транспортной услугой, а его отец помогает ему откармливать скот дома, когда он на работе. За полученные прибыли он недавно построил однокомнатный дом. На рынке ему все доверяет, и ценят его. Даже из Республики Киргизии к нему приезжает за покупками скот.  Хайдарбой хотел бы получить кредит в размере 1500$ США для покупки овец с целью расширения бизнеса. Он заранее хочет благодарит вас за вашу помощь и доброты. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Haidarboi is a goal-oriented and honest person.  He has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over six years.  He started his business with buying and selling cattle and made a good profit.  Having bought a truck, he started to provide transportation services.  His father helps him feed livestock at home, when Haidarboi is at work.  Haidarboi used his profits to recently build a one-bedroom house.  Everyone trusts and values him at the market.  Even people from the Kyrgyz Republic come and buy livestock from him.  Haidarboi wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1500 for the purchase of sheep in order to expand his business.  He wants to thanks you in advance for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Virginiah

texts.en:
Virginiah has been selling clothes and shoes for the last five years. She is separated and has two children, ages 7 and 14 years old. Virginiah has lived in Malindi town for the last 15 years. Malindi is a tourist destination town. The challenge Virginiah faces is when the town is in low season and she receives low sales and more competition from other sellers.

Virginiah has been a Milango client since June 2011. She heard about Milango from her friends and joined a self-help group. A loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings will help Virginiah restock her business with shoes and clothes so she can have enough sales to prepare some savings for her child who is entering high school next year. She will also be able to get a larger variety of items to sell. She plans to repay her loan and obtain a larger loan in order to open other centers where she can sell clothes and also employ other staff.

loans.use: to buy new stock of shoes and clothes

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
Tamer is a 24-year-old man from Marka, Amman, Jordan.

Tamer started his business some years ago from his home with only one sewing machine, then he expanded it by customizing a room to operate from.
Tamer is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase cloth and materials for his business.

An aspiration of Tamer is to develop his business and do a maintainance on his house.

loans.use: To purchase cloth.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province in Kenya. He is married and has five children, who are all in school – classes 6, 5, 3, 2, and kindergarten level two respectively. He has been operating a vegetable kiosk for five years, a venture he began to supplement his income.

He has been a client of Milango for one year and three months. A loan of 100,000 KES will help Henry to purchase a motorbike. He is a driver, too, and has links with Italian visitors to the Malindi area. Indeed, he is purchasing the motorbike in order to rent it out to tourists visiting the area. He also has three rental houses.

Henry intends to build more rental houses in the future and to buy a public transport vehicle. The main challenge he faces is a lack of capital. This loan will add to his asset base and provide him with security/collateral for future loans. It will also help to increase his family’s income. He appreciates the partnership with Milango.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Yanira Nicolasa

texts.es: Yanira, de 32 años de edad, originaria de La Reynaga una comunidad ubicada en las afueras de la ciudad de León, ella es comerciante, se dedica a elaborar artesanías de barro, es casada, tiene tres hijos de 10,13 y 3 años respectivamente. Ella empezó este negocio a los 21 años de edad por medio de una cuñada quien el enseño a elaborar artesanías de barro, aprendió a hacer jarrones, hoyas, con el paso del tiempo fue adquiriendo mas experiencia y se independizo ahora ella trabaja bajo sus propios medios. Ella vende en su comunidad y viaja hasta  el mercado central de la ciudad de Loen para ofrecer sus artesanía de barros entre las piezas mas populares que ella vende son los puerquitos que se usan para que los niños ahorren dinero. Ella realizo el  préstamo para comprar materia prima como barro, pinturas y moldes para elaborar sus artesanías además quiere invertir para cubrir los costos de importar sus artesanías a Costa Rica. Ya que con esta inversión lograr abrirse ruta para importar sus productos fuera de Nicaragua, pues una de  sus expectativas en el futuro es expandirse por toda Centro América, su meta próxima es meta es mejorar la calidad y producción de su artesanías, vender toda sus piezas cancelar su crédito y hacerle mejoras a su hogar para darle un techo digno donde sus hijos puedan vivir.
texts.en:
Yanira is 32 years old and from La Reynaga, a community on the outskirts of the city of León.  She is a businesswoman who makes handicrafts from clay.  Yanira is married and has three children aged 10, 13 and 3.  She started her business when she was 21 years old through a sister-in-law who taught her how to make handicrafts from clay.  She learned to make vases and pots.  Over time she gained more experience and started working independently.  She now works under her own means.  She sells her products in her community and travels to the central market in the city of León to offer her clay handicrafts.  One of the most popular items she sells are piggy banks in which children save their money.

Yanira requested this loan to buy raw materials such as clay, paints and molds with which to make her handicrafts.  She would also like to invest in covering the costs of exporting her handicrafts to Costa Rica.  With this investment, she will manage to open a route to exporting her products outside of Nicaragua.  One of her hopes for the future is to expand throughout Central America.  Her next goal  is to improve the quality and production of her handicrafts, to sell all her pieces, repay her loan and make some improvements to her home so that she can provide her children with a decent roof over their heads.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as clay, paints and molds to make her handicrafts and to invest in covering the costs of exporting her handicrafts to Costa Rica

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher, age 40, is a farmer who demonstrates both humility and pride in his work. He has been planting and harvesting his cornfield for almost 15 years. Christopher and his wife have two children, and he is temporarily filling the role of both father and mother to his children because his wife is an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker). 

Christopher reports difficulties in managing his cornfield because he doesn't have enough financial resources due to the family's daily household expenses, allowances, and the school fees of his children. 

Christopher currently has no choice but to get his farm inputs from traders who charge high interest rates because his field is far from the market. Christopher has decided to borrow additional capital in the amount of PhP 27,000 in order to improve his cornfield by buying farm inputs from traders who offer lower interest rates. 

He intends to use the expected profits to improve his family's standard of living and to support his children in their studies.

loans.use: to improve his cornfield by buying farm inputs

loans.name: Minata

texts.fr:
Minata  est une veuve de 56 ans vivant avec ses 4 enfants dans la grande famille de son défunt mari à Sikasso.
Minata  après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initiée à cette activité de restauration il  ya environ six  ans. Elle mène son activité devant une école tous les jours où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle composée d’ élèves et de professeurs pour la qualité de ses plats. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus d’un an. 
Après deux prêts individuels bien remboursés, elle sollicite un troisième prêt individuel lui permettant d’acheter 5 sacs de pomme de terre, 40kg de viande de bœuf, 60kg de poissons frais, 10litres d’huile alimentaire, 3 paquets de cube maggie, 2 bidons de vinaigre, 25 sachets d’Attièkè, 2 sacs de charbon de bois, 30 miches de pain et des bananes (Aloko).
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 130 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Minata is a 56-year-old widow living in Sikasso with her four children and the family of her deceased husband. After having run several business without success, she became familiar with this restaurant business about six years ago. She operates every day in front of a school, where she is much in demand by her customers, who are students and teachers, for the quality of her dishes. To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, Minata decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso over a year ago. After two individual loans, which were indeed repaid, she is requesting a third individual loan enabling her to buy: 5 sacks of potatoes, 40 kg of beef, 60 kg of fresh fish, 10 liters of cooking oil, 3 packets of Maggie bouillon cubes, 2 containers of vinegar, 25 pouches of attièkè (a cassava-based couscous), 2 sacks of charcoal, 30 loaves of bread, and some bananas (aloko). Minata envisions making a monthly profit of 130,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to help with family expenses and to cover the interest on her loan. The rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a married man with six children; four attend school while two are yet to join. His wife is a teacher who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with piped water but no electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Emmanuel has operated a livestock (cattle and goats) selling business for the past five years; in addition, he also practices small-scale farming. His potential clients are his neighbors, relatives and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase more cattle and goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu to get working capital for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle and goats for resale.

loans.name: Kelenya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KELENYA est composé de 6 femmes. RAMATA était souffrante lors de la prise des photos c’est la raison pour laquelle elles sont cinq sur la photo.
Elles sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygamiques à SANOUBOUGOU I,  un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame KADIATOU ZOUMANA , au milieu, avec des tissus  en main fait le commerce de cet article.
Elle compte acheter,  60 pagnes wax qu’elle  va revendre en détail au grand marché de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32 500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The Kelenya group is made up of 6 women. Ramata was ill when this photo was taken, which is the reason why only five women are pictured.  They are all married with a mean age of 34 years and on average three children.  They live in polygamous families in SAMBOUGOU I, one of the large neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali).

They are taking out their new loan from Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their clientele. Kadiatou Zoumana, pictured in the middle, does business with fabrics like those pictured here in her hands.  She plans to purchase 60 pagnes of "wax" [finely woven ornamental fabric] which she will resell individually at the Grand Marché of Sikasso, or in collections to a clientele composed of both men and women. 

They foresee being able to yield monthly profits of 32,000 FCFA, part of which will be used to pay the interest on their loan while the rest will become savings. She [Kadiatou] hopes to grow her turnover in order to better satisfy her clientele.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr:
Mme Binta  fait du petit commerce depuis 20 ans .Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Son activité consiste à vendre des légumes.
Avec le crédit elle va acheter des choux, des navets etc. 
Avec  le bénéfice moyen qu’elle gagne elle réussit  quand même  à payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Binta has had a small business for 20 years. She is married and a mother with a family. Her work involves selling vegetables. With this loan, she is going to buy cabbages, turnips, etc. 

With the so-so profit she makes, she is nevertheless able to cover the cost of her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to resell at the market

loans.name: Marlene Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marlene, se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo, para comprar maíz, leña, gas y otros materiales para mejorar su negocio de pupusas, ya que ahora sus clientes han aumentado por lo mismo quiere mantener la suficiente mercadería y materiales para atender la demanda.
Ella considera que ha tenido un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, su negocio ha mejorado, sus clientes han aumentado, las ganancias y las ventas hoy en día son mucho mejor.
texts.en: Marlene decided to request a new loan to buy corn, firewood, gas and other materials to improve her pupusa [Salvadoran stuffed masa flat bread] business as her clientele has increased.  For this reason she wants to stock sufficient merchandise and materials to meet the demand.  She thinks that the previous loan had a positive effect as her clientele and income have increased and her sales are much better now.

loans.use: 'purchase corn, firewood and gas.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemi de  44 de años de edad labora como docente de secundaria  desde hace 9 años, está solicitando su 7mo crédito para invertirlo en arreglo de un cuarto de su casa de habitación que se le esta deteriorando una pared, en su barrio hay buenas referencias de ella que es una persona trabajadora, responsable,  quien ha demostrado espíritu de superación, por medio de sus estudios y  y trabajo luchando cada día por salir adelante, su compañero de vida tambien se desempeña como docente ambos comparten con los gastos familiares, Su mayor sueño en la es gozar de mejores condiciones, tener trabajo, salud y sobre todo estar bien con Dios.
texts.en: Noemi, 44 years old, has worked as a secondary-school teacher for 9 years. She is asking for her seventh loan to fix a room in the house where she lives, which has a wall that is falling apart. She has good references from her neighborhood; she is a hard-working, responsible person who has demonstrated the spirit to overcome through her studies and her work fighting every day to move forward. Her life partner is also a teacher. They share family expenses. Her greatest dream is to enjoy better conditions, have work and health, and above all to be right with God.

loans.use: to plaster the walls of her house

loans.name: Au Nom De Dieu Group

texts.fr: "AU NOM DE DIEU" est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à une même Eglise. La représentante du groupe, Sophiatou (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un certain Saliou. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et deux sont à leur charge. Sophiatou  vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins du ménage. Sophiatou n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Sophiatou vend des condiments et divers produits (conserves, biscuits, etc.) dans son quartier. Sophiatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Sophiatou sollicite un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe "AU NOM DE DIEU". Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments, conserves et des biscuits.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.en:
Mrs. Jesus is a 41 year-old man, married, works arduously to offer the better to his family. Six years ago he begun his stationery store in a small scale , little by little he has gone increasing his operations and his products, at the present he has a photocopier which gives service to his clients.

When he begun his business, his target was to generate bigger revenues to cover up the necessities of his family, as well as today he has his small business where his wife helps him.

He is needing a loan for $825 USD to buy merchandise, and be prepared for the new season when his clients increase the demand for his products, he thinks to payback his loan in a term of 6-12 months. Jesus thanks the support of the people who contribute to his loan, as well as the growth of his business.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Don Jesús es un hombre de 41 años de edad, casado, que trabaja arduamente para sacar adelante a su familia. Hace aproximadamente 6 años que inicio su negocio de papelería de manera muy mínima, poco a poco ha ido incrementando sus operaciones y sus activos, en la actualidad ya tiene hasta una copiadora con la que da servicio a sus clientes.

Su objetivo al iniciar su negocio fue el de generar mayores ingresos para poder cubrir las necesidades de su familia, fue así como hoy en día tiene su pequeño negocio en donde le ayuda su esposa.

Él esta necesitando un crédito por $825 USD para destinarlo a la compra de mercancías, para de esa manera estar preparado para esta nueva temporada en que sus clientes incrementan la demanda por los productos que ofrece, piensa pagar su préstamo en un plazo de 6-12 meses. Jesús agradece el apoyo de las personas que quieran contribuir a su préstamo y de esa manera apoyar al crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to expand my business.

loans.name: Esther Reyes

texts.en:
I have been selling snacks and fast food for four years. My specialty are baleadas, savory pastries filled with beans and eggs. I also sell foods like meat and cheese tacos and enchiladas. The money I make helps me send my children to school.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Tengo 4 años de dedicarme a la venta de comidas rápidas, que en nuestro pais se le llaman golosinas. Yo vendo todas la tarde en mi comunidad. Mi especialidad son las baleadas(tortilla de harina con frijoles y huevos, mantquilla)Tambien vendo Tortillas con quesillo, carne asada, enchildas y taco. El ingreso que me genera este negocio ayudo a mis hijos con sus estudios.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like flour, beans, eggs, meat and cheese.

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
Massan S. is 50 years old with six (6) children and supports two (2) other children. Her husband is retired and has a hard time meeting his family’s needs because his pension is small and he doesn’t receive it regularly. Thanks to her business selling kitchenware, she is able to support her family.

She is asking for a loan of $800 to expand her business because new kitchenware comes out every day and her business has to be up to date to attract customers.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 50 ans Madame S. Massan épse ADJADJIHOUE est mère de six (06) enfants et deux (2) enfants à sa charge. Son mari, un retraité arrive difficilement à honorer ses engagements familiaux car sa pension bien que maigre est très rare. Grâce à son commerce des ustensiles de cuisine et en plastique, Madame S. Massan arrive à supporter la famille.

Elle sollicite un financement d’une valeur de $800 pour augmenter la taille de son activité car tous les jours les nouveautés sortent et il faut être à la page pour attirer plus de clientèle.

loans.use: To purchase kitchenware

loans.name: Taeletausia

texts.en: Taeletausia is a forty two year old woman with five children. She doesn't have a job and is now staying home to look after the children. That’s why she applied for the $300 loan to start her small business of selling ice-cake and pop-corn. Even though she sells these foods, she thinks that it is still not enough money to support her kids' education and sustain her family's needs. She is willing to get another loan to extend her business by adding a fast food stall to her current business. She is very happy for her business and she wishes to stay in it so that she can get more help through Kiva's loans.

loans.use: Buying ingredients for the business

loans.name: Dirma

texts.es:
I sell and make delicious tortillas. I've had this business on the patio of my house for 10 years. I sell to various restaurants in the city of San Lorenzo, and I also take orders from my neighbors. Now I want to buy corn, firewood, lime, and presses to make the tortillas. I would like it if you would help me buy what I need because I have various orders and also family costs from my two sons, like medicines and things they need for school. This is why I need to increase my sales.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Yo vendo y elaboro ricas tortillas, este negocio lo tengo en el patio de mi casa. Hace 10 años . Yo les vendo a varios restaurantes de la ciudad de San Lorenzo y tambien tengo pedidos de mis becinos. Ahora quiero comprar qintales de maiz, Leña, cal y comales para hacer las tortillas. Me gustaria que me ayudaran para poder compar lo que necesito, porque tengo varios pedidos y tambien gastos familiares los de mis 2 hijos que comoro medicinas y utiles de estudio y por eso necesito ingrementar las ventas.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, lime, corn, salt, and presses

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Mrs. Joy I. is 45 years old, is married with four children, and she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells fairly used clothes. She is requesting a loan of $450 to buy more fairly used clothes to sell and promises to repay it within 8 months. She has 8 years experience in business.

loans.use: Joy would like to buy more fairly used clothes to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Malikie

texts.en: Malikie is married and a father of three children. He started his business fifteen years ago on a very small scale.   With previous loans from SMT he was able to expand his business.  He has been an active and honest SMT client for the last three years and has built up his own capital.  Malikie proudly said that, with the profit from his grocery store business, he can now provide his family with three meals a day.  He still needs to expand his business and build his capital further, and is requesting a $1,200 loan to do so.

loans.use: To expand the stock of his general store so as to make more sales and earn additional profit.

loans.name: Lugoba A 2021(I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Gina N.. She is currently in the business of making and selling snacks and is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to expand her snack business. Gina is a 43 year old widow with 9 children ranging from age 2 to 20, all of whom go to school. Each week, Gina makes approximately UGX 60,000 in profit and combined with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to to improve her own and her family's standard of living.

Gina is joined in her small group by Sarah N., Claire N., Tatu N., and Dorothy Nabbosa. Sarah N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to purchase more shop items.

Claire N. is currently in the business of running a salon and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to open up a cosmetic shop.

Tatu N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to add more stock.

Dorothy Nabbosa is currently in the business of selling hardware and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to purchase more hardware equipment to sell.

loans.use: To add to snack business

loans.name: Asha's Tujitume. Group

texts.en:
Asha is 44 years old and is a widow with two children, ages 29 and 21 years. Asha owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $200 from her sales. Asha now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Asha, Habiba and Rahma, who also sell food.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Nelida Enriquela

texts.es:
Mrs. Nelida Enriquela C. is 55 years old and she completed her primary education. She has two dependent children. She lives in the province of Otuzco in La Libertad, Perú.

Nelida has a variety of businesses; she dedicates herself to buying and selling pigs that she fattens before slaughtering them and selling the meat. She also spends time weaving sweaters, scarves, ponchos, tablecloths, and dolls' dresses. In addition to this, she has a small farm where she grows potatoes that she sells with each harvest in a market. She sells all of these at a traveling cart.

She is a member of the communal bank "Sacred Heart of Jesus," where she received her first loan for $100, money that she invested in buying piglets.

With this loan for $300, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy ten baby pigs, wool and thread for her weaving, fertilizer and medicine for her planting.

Her greatest dream is to open up a shop out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nelida Enriquela C. D. C. tiene 55 años D. edad, estudio primaria completa. Tiene dos hijos en total que aun dependen D. ella. Vive en la provincia D. Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. La señora Nelida tiene varios negocios, se dedica a la compra y venta D. cerdos los cuales los engorda por un tiempo para luego sacrificarlos y vender la carne, también se dedica al tejido D. chompas, chalinas, ponchos, tapetes y trajes D. muñecas. A parte D. eso tiene una chacra en la que siembra papa la cual en cada cosecha lo venD. en el mercado en condición D. ambulante al igual que sus tejidos y la carne D. cerdo. Ella integra el Banco Comunal “Sagrado Corazón D. Jesús” donD. recibió su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 este dinero lo invirtió para comprar cerdos pequeños. Con el préstamo D. S/. 800.00 el cual será pagado en un periodo D. cuatro meses comprará 10 cerdos pequeños, lanas e hilos para hacer sus tejidos, abono y medicina para sus sembríos. Su mayor sueño es ambientar una tienda en su domicilio.

loans.use: Purchase pigs for her meat sales, wool and thread for her weaving, and fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Asombangni Fru

texts.en:
Born in 1946, Fru P. is married and has six children. He has worked very hard to provide for the needs of his family. As the head of the family, he has many burdens, especially educating his children and providing food and shelter for them. He has been a member of GHAPE since its creation and has taken out loans that he has successfully repaid. With this loan he plans to buy a motor bike for transportation and also seedlings. The bike will provide the community with transportation because in his locality the roads are bad. He will use the profits to repay his loan and pay his children's school fees.

He plans to repay the loan in 24 months. His first installment will be due on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of motorbike

loans.name: Bilquis' Group

texts.en:
Bilquis baji, wife of M. N., lives in a small city named Arifwala in Pakistan. (Baji is a term meaning 'elder sister' in Urdu). Bilquis is five years younger than her husband. She owns a two-room brick house. She is a mother of two sons. Her younger son has a fruit business. She is applying for a loan for her elder son who is 22 years old and has a crockery business. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan.

She has been joined in her group by a few more members. Akbar baji wants a loan for her jam business. Nusrat baji wants a loan for her husband’s catering business. Mukhtaran baji wants a loan for her food business. Salma baji wants a loan for her spare parts business.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Lucky

texts.en:
Lucky O. is 52 years old and is married with 4 children. He lives in Benin City, Nigeria. Lucky sells and repairs electronics. He learned this business in 18 months and he started his own business in 1992. He has been a LAPO client for the past 6 years.

Lucky needs a loan of $1, 200 USD to buy more electronics to sell. He says "thank you."

loans.use: To buy more electronics for sale

loans.name: Phall

texts.en:
Mrs. Phall P. is a farmer in Prey Totoeng Village in Kampong Speu Province. In addition to this business, she sells groceries in the local market. With her income, Mrs. Phall P. pays for her household expenses and children's education.

Her husband, Mr. Thy Eing, is a farmer (pictured with Mrs P.). Mrs. Phall P. is a 53-year-old married mother who has three children. One is employed in a garment factory, and the others are enrolled in school.

Previously, Mrs. Phall P. had a loan from AMK to buy a pump in order to water her rice field, and she has fully paid back the loan. Because her grocery business is going well, so she is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to fulfill her customers' requests. She wants to expand her business to increase her profit.

loans.use: Buy more groceries to meet customers' requests

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima baji is the wife of P. B. and lives in a small city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical places. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. She has one son. Her son runs a grocery shop. Her husband is a driver by profession. Fatima baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her son's grocery shop.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Anwar baji wants a loan to buy fruit to re-sell. Begam baji wants a loan to buy goats to re-sell. Shahida baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Hasija

texts.en: Hasija M. anović, born in 1952, lives in the village of Toj ići near Kalesija with her retired husband.  They are both very busy in their corn field and garden, producing their own vegetables and cattle feed. They were getting a calf every year from their cow that they would sell, but the cow is now too old, so Hasija is requesting a loan of $875 to buy a new one.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Mrs. Yo Srey Mao's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people in Oknha Pang Village in Kampong Chhnang Province make up this village bank and they will use the loan which they hope to obtain for different purposes.

Mrs. Yo S. M. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Ruos Vannak, is a soldier who can only make a small salary to support his household. Mrs. Yo S. M. is a 21-year-old mother with no children yet.

Mr. Chhem S. was not present at the meeting but his wife was, so she is present in the photo instead of her husband.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products for her inventory

loans.name: Gulbakh

texts.en:
Gulbakh (whose husband is pictured here) is a mother with four children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Gubadli region in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. She is settled in Absheron region. 

Her husband sells metal and has been in business for ten years. Now they need a loan of 970 AZN to buy metal for improving their business.

loans.use: to buy metal

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa O. is 39 years old. She is a wife and mother with two children. She is resourceful and very enterprising. She has supported one child through high school and is now waiting to enter university. The other one is currently in school. She operates a local restaurant and sells local food like banku-and-okro soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is eaten with hot pepper or soup. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she is no longer able to afford her normally high quality.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Nadiya

texts.en:
Nadiya is married and has two teenage children. She sells men's and women's clothes at the central market in Zaporozhye city. Nadiya has been in this business for 5 years. She has a very good location that brings many clients her way. A large assortment provides them with a good choice and increases her sales. Nadiya is a very warm and caring person. She treats her clients well and they come back.  

Nadiya is requesting a loan of $800 to increase the winter assortment. Cold winter this year brings more people to the market to buy warm clothing. Nadiya hopes to purchase more winter clothing so she can offer her clients what they need.

loans.use: to increase winter assortment of clothing

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Ángel M. es padre de familia, tiene dos hijos adolescentes que actualmente estudian.
Con 4 créditos anteriores de FVP ha construido gran partes de su vivienda y en dos cuartos le esta haciendo falta colocarles el techo. Tiene el proyecto de construir una losa de concreto para que la casa sea más segura y duradera.
El esta solicitando un préstamo para realizar la mejora y planea pagarlo con sus ingresos como jefe del aria de tráfico en una compañía de trasportes.
 Su deseo es que sus hijos tengan su propio espacio y vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Señor Miguel Angel Martinez is a parent, with two teenage children who are currently studying. With four previous loans with FVP he has constructed much of his housing. In two rooms, he is putting in a roof where it is missing. He is planning to build a concrete slab so that the home will be more secure and durable. He is requesting a loan to make additional home improvements and plans to pay it back with income as the head of air traffic for a transportation company. He dreams that his sons will have their own space and live a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Concrete slab

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene un hijo mayor de edad, todos ellos viven en su casa, que con mucho esfuerzo lograron construir. Desde muy joven se dedicó al comercio, con el tiempo pudo obtener un puesto propio, con el paso de los años fue creciendo y hace 15 años se consolidó como una de las tiendas más concurridas de la zona, ahora requiere de la ayuda de una tercera persona para atender su negocio de lubricantes. Ella está segura de que su negocio  seguirá creciendo, pues acaba de invertir en la compra de repuestos que son muy dificiles de encontrar y son muy necesarios para las reparaciones de todo tipo de vehículos, convirtiéndose así en proveedores de algunas mecánicas que ubicadas en su distrito. Carmen tiene la proyección de llegar a prestar servicios de mantenimiento a cualquier auto, pues cuenta con todos los instrumentos necesarios, sólo requiere de personal y de un local adecuado donde instalarse. Carmen inició sus préstamos en MFP hace 7 años y piensa que la instituición es una opción de desarrollo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de repuestos, los cuales son muy costosos e invertiría en ello 3500 soles, para incrementar su ganancias y tener cada vez más cerca la realización de sus metas como empresaria.
texts.en:
Carmen is forty-three years old, married, and has one, grown, son. Carmen, her husband, and her son, all live in their house -- which, with much effort, they have built. Carmen has been in merchandise since she was very young, and in time was able to get her own stall. As time wore on, Carmen’s business grew. Fifteen years ago, she consolidated her business, just as many of the very busy stores in the area have done. Now she needs a third person to help out with her lubricant business. She is sure her business will continue to grow. She just purchased some hard-to-find replacement parts that are necessary for the repair of any kind of vehicle, so that she could supply local mechanics. Carmen could service any vehicle. She has all the necessary tools, and now all she needs is an employee and a good location in which to set up shop. Carmen started her loans with MFP seven years ago, and she thinks that the institution is an opportunity for the development of her business. With the money she requests, Carmen will purchase lots of replacement parts, which are very expensive (she will spend 3500 soles on them) to increase her income and grow closer to her goals as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her merchandise

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
This is thirty-four years old Janeth M. from Mwanza. She is single with two children.  Janeth has run a tailoring resale business since 1996.  She works twelve hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Janeth currently earns about 150 USD a month from her business.  She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to buy materials for making women clothes for resale.  In the future, Janeth plans to increase her stock. She thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the 
Future.

loans.use: Buy materials for making cloth and resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing used clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Toalua

texts.en: Toalua M., 44, is married with 2 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 5 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 360 Tala (about US $113).  SPBD loans are Toalua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She will use her loan for school needs and home improvement.

loans.use: School fees and home improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell staple goods

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Hardworking and determined, Mrs. Jean S. is from Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 43 years old, married and has been blessed with four children who are studying in primary and secondary levels. Her husband is a farmer. Her corn production project is still in the growing phase. She requests a loan of 4,000 PHP to defray operating expenses for her corn-growing land. She needs to meet farm expenses such as fertilizers and labor costs. She hopes and prays that her business will expand and earn enough savings for her children’s education. She is thankful for the continued assistance and support of Paglaum, especially now that Kiva is helping MFI entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Payment for labor and to purchase fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Neak

texts.en: S. N., 23, is a local grocery seller. She sells items such as cooking ingredients to her clients, most of whom are her neighbors. She also sells sweets to kids. She is married with two minor children who are enrolled in primary school. She applies a loan for capital to accrue her grocery inventory to sell. This will help her to grow her investment and provide more additional income. S. N. was not available for photo, so her mother is shown in the picture instead.

loans.use: To accrue grocery inventory to sell

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en: Meriam A. is a 45-year-old single woman. She is persevering and striving hard for a better life.  She lives with her father in the beautiful island village of Kinabaogan in Binangonan town, which is located in Rizal province in the Philippines. In 2008 she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, and is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to use as additional capital for her retail business of beauty products, clothes, slippers, shoes, underwear, and many other ready-to-wear products.  She dreams of earning a good profit so that she can save for her father's medical needs and to help pay the school fees for her nephews.  Also she will make some repairs to their house.  She hopes that someday her business will grow and expand to offer delivery to nearby places.

loans.use: As additional capital for retail of beauty products, and other ready-to-wear products.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita R., a 40-year old entrepreneur who lives with her three children (Jerlyn-17, Erica-16 and Mark-14) in Bagong Silang, Caloocan City, Philippines, has been a businesswoman for 10 years. She began with a sari-sari (variety) store, but cooking and selling breakfast goodies and snacks is what she most likes to do, so she has set-up a small “stand-up café” beside her store. She has her breakfast goodies and snacks in a small display case on top of a table.

Merlita and her husband parted ways years ago. Life was hard for her because she was left to take care of her three children, but thanks to her perseveR. and desire to move forward, she has achieved good results with her business. Her love for her children gives her the necessary strength to keep working for a better future. She now earns P25,000 per month from her business.

Merlita is now applying for a new loan of P15,000 from CCT Credit Cooperative, her eighth with the organization. She has always been very punctual in all of her payments and will be using the money to buy additional merchandise for her store. She also wants to expand her operation into a big convenience store so she won’t need to request loans in the future.

About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for the expansion of her store.

loans.name: Capianila

texts.en:
"Achieving success in life is a difficult thing to attain," said Capianila M.. She is thankful that she was blessed with five children and grandchildren that serve as her source of happiness.  

Capianila is already 56 years old but despite her age, she is still strong and very determined to improve her store for her family. At present, she would like to request a loan of PHP5,000 from Kiva lenders. She hopes that her loan will be granted for she plans to utilize the loan for the improvement of her store located in the rural village of San Antonio, Jones, Isabela.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Raúl Enrique

texts.es: Raúl Enrique P. L. vive en el municipio de Tonacatepeque en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos. La casa P. nunca esta callada, pues su hijo menor tiene apenas 3 meses de vida. Raúl maneja desde su propia casa un negocio de venta de pizza que administra junto a su esposa. Mantener a 4 hijos no es fácil, y por eso Raúl solicita un préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio y hacer que este crezca más, para poder ofrecer una mejor vida para su familia y su hijo recién nacido.
texts.en:
Raúl Enrique P. L. lives in the town of Tonacatepeque, which is in the town of San Salvador. He lives with his wife and their four children. The P. household is never quiet because their youngest child is only 3 months old.

Raúl has a pizzeria in his home that he manages with his wife. Having four children is not easy. For this reason, Raul is requesting a loan to reinvest into his business so that it can continue to grow. This will enable him to provide a better life for his family and his newborn son.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making pizza

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie C. is from the village of Banawan, Iligan City. She is 47 years old. Elsie is married and has 3 adult children. Elsie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. She sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elsie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Aamache

texts.en: Aamache is a 55-year-old married father of six children. He has owned a car mechanic shop since 2003 and this is how he supports his family. Aamache is requesting a $1,200 loan.  He will use it to buy more tools and to enlarge his shop to meet the needs of his clients so he can continue to earn a good income for his family.

loans.use: To buy more tools for his car mechanic shop.

loans.name: Peace And Unity Group

texts.en:
Here are Zainab K., Hawa M. and Kadiatu S. of the "Peace and Unity" loan group. They are small-scale businesswomen from the northern City of Makeni. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva.  With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profits. Consequently, their living standards will improve, they can at least provide three meals a day for their children, pay their schools fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills in case any of them fall sick. 

Zainab K. (on the left in the photograph) is the leader of this group. Zainab was born in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. She is forty-two year old and is married to a monthly wage earner. They have three children. One of her children is in Junior Secondary School II, the other is in class VI and the other in class IV. Zainab sells sardines, powdered milk, books, cigarettes, and so on. She has been in a businesswoman for six years.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Gulomdjon

texts.en: B. Gulomdjon is 52 years old and is married with three children. Thanks to the efforts of Gulomdjon, all of his children are married with their own families. Gulomdjon provides taxi services using his car. He has been in this business for the last two years and has gained a rich experience in driving. He has always tried to provide high quality services and, at the same time, charge prices that are attractive to his customers. Gulomdjon is doing his best to make his business stable and profitable as he is the main bread-winner of his large family. He is ready to work from early morning till late at night in order to keep his customers and obtain new ones. Currently, Gulomdjon needs to repair some parts of his car and for this reason he requests 1,500 US Dollars. He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. The well-being of this family is in your hands. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for repairing his car

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en: Zenabu is a 54-year-old married mother of four children who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming town in the western region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants practice farming alongside other trading activities. Zenabu is a food vendor. She prepares and sells porridge. She prepares the porridge in her house and sells by the roadside in the morning in her community. Zenabu buys the raw materials from nearby communities. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize in bulk

loans.name: Surmaahorloo

texts.en:
Surmaahorloo O. is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her oldest son, Bilguunsaikhan, is seven years old and attends a local secondary school. Her youngest, Turbold, has not yet reached school age. Surmaahorloo operates a dairy product selling business in her town. She started her business in 2000 by renting a stall at the local market to sell her products. After years of successful business operations, she used her savings to build a small shop in 2007. Having her own shop has been very positive for her business and she has built a great reputation among her many customers. Surmaahorloo attributes her success to her good accounting skills. She has many plans for the future and says, "I want to expand my business and build an addition on to my shop." She is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~1,050 USD) loan to purchase dairy products to sell in her business. 

About XacBank:

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To purchase dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Rosa E

texts.es:
La señora ROSA E A. R. tiene 64 años, vive en el distrito de MOCHE , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal VIRGEN DE FATIMA . La socia presenta estudios secundarios completos, es casada y tiene 5 hijos todos mayores e independientes. 
La socia se dedica a la venta de quesos, roscas, manjar blanco , quesillos, yogurt, etc . 
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò quesos, quesillos, roscas y manjar blanco al por mayor.
Ella solicitarà un crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que tambièn comprarà productos lácteos como: quesos, quesillos, yogurt, roscas, etc. para luego distribuir a sus clientes y a los diferentes mercados. 
Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa E A. R. is 64 years old and lives in the district of Moche, province of Trujillo, and department of La Libertad in Peru. She belongs to the communal bank "Virgen de Fatima". Our partner has completed secondary education, is married, and has 5 children, who are grown up and independent. She makes a living by selling cheese, bread rolls, caramel spread, yogurt, etc. With her first credit of 300.00 nuevos soles she purchased cheese, rolls, and caramel spread wholesale. Now, she is requesting another loan of 300.00 to buy the same products, to later distribute them to her clients and to different markets. Her dream is to increase her sales and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheese, caramel spread, bread rolls, yogurt, etc. for her business

loans.name: Aurea Maribel

texts.es:
Aurea es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos y su padre en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace un año instaló en su vivienda una pequeña bodega donde ofrece a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), abarrotes, golosinas y bebidas. La idea de ese negocio nació a raíz de la necesidad de ayudar a sostener la economía familiar, ya que lo que su esposo percibía como trabajador agrícola no le bastaba para sacarlos adelante.

El negocio goza de buena acogida entre sus clientes ya que la zona en donde viven queda alejada del mercado del distrito y el establecimiento ofrece muchos productos de consumo diario. Aurea desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de bebidas por lo que se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir haciendo crecer su negocio para bridarle a sus hijos una mejor educación. Este es su segundo crédito con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente responsable y puntual al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Aurea is a 37-year-old mother that lives with her husband, their two children and her father in the district of Paiján, province of Ascope, in the La Libertad region, located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. A year ago she installed a small convenience store in her dwelling where she offers her clients basic foods(rice, sugar, oil), groceries, delicacies and beverages. The idea for the business came about because of the need to help maintain the family finances, since what her husband received as an agricultural worker did not suffice to get ahead. The business is well recieved among its clients since the zone where they live is far away from the market of the district and the establishment offers many daily consumer goods. Aurea desires to expand her business with the purchase of beverages, for which she applied to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1000 Soles. Her greater wish is to continue growing her business in order to give her children a better education. This is her second loan with our Institution and she has shown to be a punctual and responsible client in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carbonated beverages to grow her business.

loans.name: Azizboy

texts.en: Azizboy D. has dedicated much effort to the business of agriculture for 20 years. He has land where produces different kinds of vegetables. He gets a rich harvest every year from his land. From the savings from his land, he could arrange the wedding of his two children. Currently Azizboy is asking for a loan of 7,000 Somoni in order to purchase fuels and lubricants, mineral fertilizer and saplings for expanding his business. Azizboy is very confident that he will be awarded this loan and assures you that he will repay the loan on time with no violations. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fuels and lubricants, mineral fertilizer and saplings

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida L. is a married woman who supports her family by fish vending. She lives in Sto.
