Catinggib, Barangay Suay, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental, with her husband and their three children who are between the ages of 16 and 19 years. All three children are attending school. Nida has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish-vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 12,000. Nida is now borrowing Php 10,000 so that she can expand her fish-vending business. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 13,000, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Nida aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Fernan

texts.es:
Fernan C. A., tiene la edad de 27 años, está soltero, y vive con su madre.El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono, fertilizante y hervicidas, para darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café, y así lograr una mejor calidad y obtener un mayor ingreso cuando sea tiempo de la cosecha. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Fernan tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Fernan C. A. is 27 years old and lives with his mother. He wants the loan to help his farm, specifically to cultivate cafe. He wants to buy fertilisers and herbicides to adequately maintain his coffee cultivation, to achieve better quality and obtain better earninigs when harvest time comes. This isn't the first time he has had a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the facilities that they provide him. Don Fernan has been working in agriculture for several years. His hope for the future is to give his family a better quality of life and improved economic stability, and to be able to continue growing as a person and producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilisers and herbicides

loans.name: Fatima Issufo

texts.pt:
Fátima Issufo Ibrahimo B. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique tem 29 anos de idade, mãe de 2 filhos de 12 e 8 anos de idade, os dois vão a escola. Fez 12ą classe parou devido a insuficiência de fundos, mas pretende concorre para o ensino superior. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta a sua mãe que vive com ela.
Saiu da cidade de Maputo para Boane a procura de emprego e melhores condições de vida. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 5 anos e conta com um empregado que lhe auxilia no seu trabalho, para alem deste, trabalha também numa empresa de produção de fotografias e filmagem (FUJI), há mais de 1 ano. Neste emprego tem um salário mensal de 3.000.00mt, e um rendimento do seu negócio de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar cerca de 500.00mt por mês na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de pessoas mais próximas que são clientes desta instituição a longo tempo. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (vassouras, ancinhos, topos de limpeza e outros) para aumentar e fortificar ainda mais o seu negócio. O empréstimo anterior foi de 150.000.00mt, para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este crédito para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos com a finalidade construir um estabelecimento condigno para o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Fatima Issufo Ibrahimo B. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. She is 29 years old and is the mother of 2 children who are 12 and 8 years old. Both children attend school. Fatima studied through 12th grade and then stopped because of a lack of funds, but she plans to pursue more advanced studies. She lives in her own home with her family and she also cares for her mother, who lives with her. She left Maputo for Boane in search of work and better living conditions. She has had her own business for more than 5 years and has one employee who helps her with her work. On top of this, for the past year she has also been working in a company that produces photographic film (Fuji). In this job she earns a monthly salary of 3000.00 Meticales and her business earnings come to around 4000.00 Meticales a month. She uses this income to cover household expenses and she also saves around 500.00 Meticales a month in her bank account. Fatima has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through people close to her who have worked with the institution for a long time. This is her 2nd loan, for the amount of 15,000.00 Meticales. She plans to use this money to buy products (brooms, rakes, cleaning products and other items) in order to expand and strengthen her business. Her earlier loan was for 150,000.00 Meticales and was used for the same purpose. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans in order to construct a satisfactory building for her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of brooms, mops and rakes

loans.name: Sura

texts.en: Sura A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and groundnut paste (peanut butter) and is requesting a loan to stock more groundnuts to make paste to sell. Sura is 40 years old and is widowed. She has six children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store for charcoal. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more groundnuts to make paste to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is widowed and the mother of seven children, some of whom are still in school while others are out of school and working. The fifty-four year old businesswoman lost her husband some years ago and has since been the sole provider for the family. Her children are between the ages of thirty – two and twenty. Some of the grown-ups are married and live with their spouses. 

Mary lives with the younger ones in a rented apartment in her community. The hard-working widow delights in sales and has been a merchant for the past thirty-five years. She sells groceries and other food items such as cooking oil, rice, spices, etc. 

It is Mary’s dream to increase her profit margin and be able to give her younger children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
El señor Leoncio E. tiene 38 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Encarnación.
Es propietario de un negocio en el nuevo circuito comercial que se dedica a la venta de productos naturales remedios   elaborados .
Es una persona muy trabajadora y gracias a la actividad que realiza ha podido salir adelante e ir creciendo  en su micro- Empresa.
 El Destino del crédito fue para realizar compras de mas productos naturales que están saliendo en el mercado(adelgasantes y energisantes).

.
texts.en:
Leoncio E., 38, lives in the city of Encarnación. He has a store in the new shopping circuit where he sells natural remedies. He is a very hard-working person and thanks to the work he does he has been able to get ahead and have his micro business grow. He will use the requested funds to buy more natural products that are coming into the market (weight loss and energy). .

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural remedies.

loans.name: Faith Achieng

texts.en:
Faith Achieng A. is a 26-year-old mother of three children. She is married and lives with her family in Rongo. Faith quit her business selling clothes and started a tailoring business in 2008 to generate income to support her family. She travels as far as Kisii on a weekly basis to purchase her stock. 

In addition to her business, Faith also supports some of the orphans within her community with the little income she generates from her business. She  wishes to expand her business so that she will be able to fully support her family and the orphans that are under her care, including their education.

After learning about the work that KMET does in relation to supporting small scale businesses, she decided to join the group. She would like to get a loan for 30,000 KES.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo Renacer es un excelente grupo, que trabaja en forma solidaria, todas las integrantes asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para el bien común del grupo.
Una de las señoras es Doña Daniela quien es costurera, ella confecciona varios tipos de prendas para damas y caballeros. 
Ella hace las confecciones de acuerdo a los pedidos de los clientes quienes llegan hasta su casa para la solitar su confección. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser eléctrico con varias funciones.
texts.en:
“Renacer” (Rebirth) is the name of this excellent solidarity group. All of the members attend the weekly meetings and participate in activities for the common good of the group.

One of the members is Doña Daniela, who works as a seamstress. She makes various types of clothes for women and men. The clothing she produces is designed according to the requests of her customers who come to her house to place their orders. She is requesting a loan to buy an electric sewing machine with various functions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Zahra Saman Group

texts.en:
This is Ahmad Gull, the son of J. M.. He is the leader of Zahra Saman group. Ahmad Gull is 49 years old and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a married man with seven children.
Ahmad Gull has a shop where he sells flour and cooking oil. All his family members benefit from the income he generates. He has been involved in this business for more than four years. He wakes up early in the morning ready to work hard and sell more in order to have a high monthly income. He would like to expand his business and make his shop larger. He has requested a loan to buy more flour and oil for his shop. Ahmad Gull is grateful to the lenders who give the opportunity for entrepreneurs to support themselves and their families through this process.

loans.use: To buy more flour and oil for his shop

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina P. is currently in the business of selling fish, tomatoes, onions and cooking oil. She is requesting a loan to stock Irish potatoes to sell. 

Regina is 46 years old and married to a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica, de 37 años y está casada con Luis de 33 años, ambos tienen tres hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Desde hace 11 años, que junto a su esposo siembra papa, arveja y habas, en terrenos que posee y en otro que son arrendados, asimismo cría animales como cerdo y asno. Por otro lado, los días que descansan se queda cuidando su hogar, mientras su esposo trabaja en otros terrenos, ganando S/20.00 soles el día, y con esas ganancias cubren los gastos domésticos, ya que los ingresos que obtiene de la comercialización de su cosecha lo invierten para mejorar su producción. Lo que más Le gusta es cosechar y comercializar sus productos, por tanto planea comprar más terrenos, para sembrar más arveja y papa, además sus compañeros la motivan a sembrar flor gladiolos, por la demanda que tiene en el mercado. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y está contenta de trabajar en su grupo comunal, con personas honestas y trabajadores como ella. Con los quinientos soles que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono, que esparcirá en sus sembríos de arveja ya desarrollados.
texts.en:
Angelica is 37 years old and is married to the 33 year old Luis. Together they have 3 children, with whom they live in their own home. For 11 years, they have cultivated potatoes, peas, and broad beans on land that they own and on some that is rented. They also raise livestock such as pigs and donkeys. Angelica spends her days off caring for their home while her husband works on other farms, earning S/20.00 soles a day. With those earnings they cover their household expenses, since the profits from the sale of their harvest are invested to improve production. What she likes best is harvesting and selling her products. She plans to buy more land and plant more peas and potatoes. Her friends have also advised her to plant gladiola flowers, since they are in demand in the market. This will be her third loan with MFP, and she is happy working in her communal group with honest hardworking people like herself. With the five hundred soles she is requesting, she will buy several bags of fertilizer to spread in the pea fields.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith A. is from the village of Binakalan, Gingoog City. She is 36 years old. Judith is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Judith owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling sweetened and salted peanuts in the local community. Judith has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Judith joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judith is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Judith from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.   Susan has a business of selling charcoal, which she has had for 6 years.         

To help expand her business, Susan has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Susan hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young sisters.  In the future, Susan hopes to own a house. 


Note to lenders: 

BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal

loans.name: Kaiyrsa's Group

texts.en: Kaiyrsa S. is the leader of this group. She is fifty-seven and a widow. She has three sons and they are twenty-three, twenty-eight and thirty-three. Her two elder sons work in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan) and her youngest son has a childhood disability. Her elder sons live independently and help Kaiyrsa to provide for herself and her youngest son. Still, Kaiyrsa decided to start cattle breeding in order to have an additional source of income and therefore applied for this loan. Also, according to Kyrgyz national traditions she has to celebrate her grandson’s first birthday. Unfortunately, she doesn’t have sufficient funds to do so. Only with the help of the loan will she be able to purchase cattle and to celebrate her grandson’s birthday. The other group members are: Altynbiubiu I. is the treasurer of the group. She is forty and married with two children: her son is fourteen and her daughter is five. Her husband is a forester while her elder son goes to school and her youngest daughter is at home. Altynbiubiu sells consumer goods, mostly office and school accessories. She started her business after her marriage upon the suggestion of her friend. Now, she is already six years in business after starting with an initial investment of 15,000 soms. She earns 9,000 soms each month from her business and, with the help of her husband, she also breeds cattle. With the profits from her business and cattle breeding, she is able to purchase household appliances and significantly increase the number of her cattle. Now she is planning to expand her business and therefore is applying for a loan which would help her to purchase additional cattle and purchase goods in order to the increase turnover of her business. Chyngyz M. U. is twenty and single and lives with his mother and father, both of whom are pensioners. He decided to start cattle breeding in order to provide for his family. He is applying for a loan to buy cattle for fattening and sale. Ishenbiubiu A. is sixty-two and married. She is a pensioner with a son twenty-four years old. Her son works at a local center of national education and receives 3,000 soms as a monthly salary. Ishenbiubiu is applying for a loan in order to start breeding cattle. She is planning to purchase cattle and hay for feed. With the help of her son, she will fatten the cattle for sale at a higher price. With the profits, she is planning to increase the number of her cattle. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and to celebrate her grandson’s birthday

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy L. is from the town of Banga. She is 29 years old. Mary Joy is married and has a three-year-old child. To make a living, Mary Joy owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice to sell. Mary Joy has been engaged in her business for over four years.

Mary Joy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Mary Joy is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Mary Joy from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros G. is a married woman who lives in Purok 6, Barangay Giligan, Siaton, Negros Oriental. She and her husband earn their living by operating two business ventures, a general store and an herbal medicine dealership. Milagros operates the general store and her husband, Papias Geromal, who is 34 years old, is an herbal medicine dealer. They have three children who are between the ages of 5 months and 14 years old. 

Milagros joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Milagros and her husband have been incrementally lifting their family out of poverty by the sweat of their brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $280, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy more stock to sell in her general store. She also wants to use part of the money to purchase a motorcycle to use for the business. She and her husband want to earn more money in order to save up for the future education of their children. Milagros G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Eligio

texts.en:
Mr. Eligio has a convenience store in the Santa Ana neighborhood. Through several years he's built a good customer base and a stable income. 

Thanks to his family's support and teamwork they have been able to progress and make the business grow. 

As a client with Fundacion Paraguaya, Mr. Eligio has demonstrated to be an honest, responsible person and worthy of support.

loans.use: Bread, coffee, milk products, pasta, flour.

loans.name: José Leonel

texts.es: El Sr. José Leonel H. H. él se dedica a la actividad de siembra de granos como maíz, frijoles tiene  doce   año de dedicarse a actividad, es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para preparar el terreno y comprar los materiales  para la siembra,   los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Mr. José Leonel H. H. plants crops like corn and beans.  He has been doing this type of work for 12 years and he is married.  He has had two loans through CEPRODEL, and he has used both to prepare his land and to buy supplies for planting.  The CEPRODEL loans have been of great benefit to him, as they are the means by which he has improved his and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: for agricultural expenses and to buy supplies

loans.name: Amazonas Del Sur Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Amazonas del Sur, y se ubica en el Estado de Morelos en México, esta comunidad se distingue por su rio de nombre Amacuzac que en la  temporada de lluvia se vuelve muy caudaloso y que abastece una importante presa para la comunidad porque permite tener 2 cosechas durante el año. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes. María Yesenia J. P. es integrante del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de queso, negocio que inicio hace 5 años, solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la elaboración del queso, va a comprar sal, blanqueador, cuajo, ingredientes indispensables en la elaboración. Ella tiene 23 años, estudio hasta el 3er  año del bachillerato, es soltera y no tiene hijos, sus clientes están a gusto porque sus quesos tienen muy buen sabor además de que es una persona amable con ellos, al momento de solicitar el préstamo se siente contenta porque va a aumentar su producción de queso , quiere este crédito para hacer más grande su negocio, con las ganancias espera comprar carne para volver abrir su carnicería, ya que anteriormente estudiaba y por falta de tiempo tuvo que cerrar
texts.en:
This group is called ‘Amazonas del Sur’. They are located in the state of Morelos in Mexico. The community is known for the Amacuzac river, which becomes plentiful in the rainy season and is an important resevoir for the community because it allows them to have two harvests a year. 

The group is made up of 10 members, one of whom is María Yesenia J. P.. She began her business making cheese five years ago. She is currently requesting a loan to purchase essential ingredients like salt, whitener and rennet to make cheese.

María is 23 years old, has completed three years of high school, is single and has no children. Her customers are happy with her because her cheese is very tasty, and she treats her customers with kindness. María is happy requesting this loan because it will increase her cheese production, and she hopes that this will in turn expand her business. With her earnings she hopes to purchase enough meat to re-open her butcher’s shop. Previously, she was studying, and she did not have enough time for it and had to close it down.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make cheese

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Laguna Grande, una zona agrícola del distrito de Santa Rosa, ubicado a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con un grupo de vacas, las cuales cría en un ambiente ubicado cerca a su vivienda, Natividad extrae diariamente la leche que estas producen y las ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y pobladores de su distrito. El ya tiene más de diez años dedicándose a esta actividad y esta se ha consolidado como la principal fuente de ingreso con la que actualmente cuenta su familia.

Natividad desea adquirir alimento balanceado y forraje para brindárselo a sus vacas y lograr que estas mejoren su producción, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa realizar su inversión y aumentar sus ganancias.

Natividad es bastante conocido y respetado por los pobladores de su comunidad, ellos le consideran alguien responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Natividad is 47 years old.  He is married and lives with his family in the town of Laguna Grande, a farming area of Santa Rosa district which is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Natividad has a herd of cows which he raises close to his home.  He takes the milk which the cows produce on a daily basis and offers it for sale to his neighbors and the residents of his district. He has been in this business for more than ten years and it has become the main source of income for his family.

Natividad would like to acquire balanced feed and fodder for his cows so that he can get them to improve their production.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can make his investment and increase his profits.

Natividad is quite well known and respected by the residents of his community.  They consider him to be a responsible and trustworthy person.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed and fodder for his dairy herd

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia tiene 45 maños de edad, es socia del banco comunal  Madre Coraje, del distrito de calleria departamento de Ucayali, tiene 45 años, está casada y su esposo se desempeña como maestro panadero, tiene 3 hijos que están estudiando.
La señora Sonia lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos 5 años y lo ha sabido invertir adecuadamente, porque tiene una panadería, que ahora por fiestas de fin de año también realizan el servicio de asado de todo tipo de carnes.
Con el nuevo préstamo de S/. 2000.00 soles, Sonia invertirá en insumos para preparar panetones, como son: 20 kg  frutas confitadas, 10 kg  pasas, 1 botella de esencias,  2 kg de levadura,  5 sacos de harina,5 casilleros de huevo, 2 paquetes de bolsa, 1 ciento de papel para envoltura.
La señora Sonia  está feliz  porque está sacando adelante su negocio y además genera trabajo para 3 personas más que son sus trabajadores,  por ahora está con un horno artesanal, mas adelante piensa comprar un horno eléctrico que le hace mucha falta.
texts.en: Sonia is 45 years old and she is a member of the community bank Madre Coraje located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 45 years old, she is married, and her husband works as a master baker. They have 3 children who are attending school. Sonia has been working with loans through Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 5 years and she has been able to invest them adequately because she has a bakery. During the end of year holidays she also makes all types of roast meats. With her new loan of 2000 nuevos soles, Sonia will invest in the purchase   of ingredients to make panetone breads, including: 20kg of candied fruits, 10 kg of raisins, 1 bottle of extract, 2kg of yeast, 5 sacks of flour, 5 crates of eggs, 2 packages of bags, 1 package of paper for wrapping. Sonia is very happy because she is finding success in her business and she is able to create work for 3 other people. She currently works with a standard oven but in the future she hopes to purchase an electric oven that she needs very much.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Joyeux Lutins Plus Group

texts.en:
Jacques is the leader of the community bank “Joyeux Lutins Plus” which is composed of 16 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Jacques, 43, is married and has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2008. He operates a general store to the west of Kinshasa. He has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize his dream of one day opening two large stores in Kinshasa. He would also like to achieve financial independence through his business, which currently earns him $180 per week. He works to the best of his abilities and uses his contacts so that he might achieve his goals.

Jacques is a trustworthy client of MFI HOPE RDC, having three times obtained and correctly repaid loans. He will increase his stock of merchandise with his next loan, buying cans, sacks of sugar and milk to resell for a profit. Jacques has four children aged 2 to 14, three of whom attend school.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, sugar and milk for resale.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
Maria Francisca M. M. tiene 57 años, es soltera, vive sola en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 1 hija que hace mucho tiempo se fue a España a buscar trabajo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Maria Francisca se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Farma-Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es que su hija regrese del extranjero.

Le gusta ver televisión y caminar.
texts.en:
Maria Francisca M. M. is 57 and single. She lives alone in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. She has one daughter who went to Spain in search of work a long time ago.

The members of the V.R.C. Tierra Nuestra ["Our Land"] are located in the San Luis de Zapotal area, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The 14 members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, sowing corn and rice.
Maria Francisca works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. She purchases her products in Farma-Agro and sells them in the same location.

She is requesting this loan for sowing corn and rice, and to purchase supplies and seeds. The support of this loan will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is for her daughter to return from abroad.

She enjoys watching television and walking.

loans.use: The purchase of supplies and seeds

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkan, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 44 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Marka-Coungo, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitiés. Elles font le commerce des habits, de gâteaux et du lait.                                                                                                                                                      
Les femmes du groupe Benkan sont à leur septième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des pagnes wax, de la farine de blé et du lait.                                                                             
BATA D., la présidente du groupe,  compte acheter 100 pièces de pagnes wax avec les grossistes au marché de Bamako presque chaque mois. Elle revend au marché et à domicile, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, une partie pour prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkan group, all married, are on average 44 years old with three children each, and all live in large traditional families in the village of Marka-Coungo, a sub-prefecture of Fana, in the region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They have known each other as fellow parents, neighbors, and friends.  They sell clothing, cakes, and milk.

The women of the Benkan group are requesting their seventh group loan, which will be used to purchase fine fabrics, flour, and milk.

Bata D., the president of the group, intends to purchase 100 lengths of fabric from the wholesale dealers at the market in Bamako nearly every month.   She resells them in the market and out of her home, for cash or credit, to a clientele made up of women and men.  She foresees earning a monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA which she will use to pay their loan installments, in part to assume health and food expenses, to cover school fees, and the remainder will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: Purchasing fabric

loans.name: Nop

texts.en:
Nop S. is a businesswoman who has been operating her own small business for years. She sells vegetables, fresh fish, and other meats in her community in Kompong Cham province. She was married, but she has been divorced from her husband for many years, and now lives with her three single children. She typically earns an average income of $3 each day to use for the whole family.

Currently, she always needs to hire a taxi to deliver her items to her selling place because she has no vehicle. Nop S. is taking out her loan to buy a used motorcycle which will be used to transport her goods, and the rest of fund will be used to buy more vegetables, fresh fish, and meats to sell.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle to transport her goods, and to buy more vegetables, fresh fish, and meats to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
The woman shown in the picture above, Khorn R. is a 30-year-old farmer residing in a rural area of Kompong Tom Province. She raises some pigs in a pigpen behind her house. Eventually, she sells her pigs to a slaughterer in four-month cycles. Beside this work, she has also been planting rice crops; that is her annual business. Her husband is a fisherman as well as a firewood seller.

 Khorn R. is looking for a loan as capital to support her farming business. She will use the loan to buy a cow to plow their farmland and transport firewood to sell in the marketplace. Khorn R. has five single children of whom three are attending school.

loans.use: To buy a cow to plow the farmland and transport firewood to sell in the marketplace.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 45 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha trabajado mucho por forjarse un buen futuro, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Florentino de 49 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una buena educación. La tienda de abarrotes de Carmen es una de las más visitadas de la ciudad de Tarma, desde muy temprano por la mañana abre su tienda en espera de que sus clientes lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y esta dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 4 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. En adelante, espera poder hacer ampliar su tienda y llenarla de más mercadería, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos. Es el décimo primer crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos, para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en: Carmen, 45 years old, is a woman who throughout her life has worked hard to forge a good future. She lives in her own home together with her husband Florentino, 49, and their two beloved children, whom they want to give a good education. Carmen's grocery store is one of the most visited in the city of Tarma.  She opens very early in the morning, waiting for the customers to come buy what they need. She is a very attentive and happy saleswoman; she always greets her customers with a smile and is always ready to help them with their purchases. What she likes most about her job is talking with her customers.  She has been in this business for 4 years and thinks the hardest part is having to be open all day long without being able to leave.  In the future, she hopes to be able to increase the size of the store and add more merchandise, so that she can offer her customers a better variety of products.  This is her 11th loan with MFP and she is ready to make all of her payments on time, since she doesn't want to cause problems for the village bank where she is very well liked by the rest of the members.  With the 3,000 nuevo soles that she has requested, she will buy more products so that she can better run her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more products to better run her store

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock has been a farmer in Kisii Town in South Rift, Kenya where he lives with his family. His farm produces tea, coffee, milk and vegetables which are sold mainly to Kenya Tea Development Authority and Keya Co-operative Society. He is married with eight children, six of them still in school. He works as a builder for additional income.

Enock has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the cow will provide milk for family consumption and to sell to help educate the children. He plans to open a retail shop in the local market to help him subsidize the income from farming and building.

Enock adds that Juhudi Kilimo has helped its clients with farming knowledge through training and the loans have had a great impact on quite a number of families in the area.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune H. lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Gtashen. She is married and has three sons (nineteen, twenty-three and twenty-four years old). Nune has been farming the land for over twenty three years. She considers herself to be a honest hard-working person. In addition to providing for her family, Nune also provides relatives living in the city with produce grown on the family farm. 

She is pleased with microfinance services and is looking for a loan to purchase seeds, animal feed, fertilizer and fuel. She expects this investment to increase the family income by twenty percent. She dreams that her children will have happy and healthy lives. Nune enjoys the fresh air and the natural environment of the village of Gtashen.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, animal feed, fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en:
Eusebia H. is from the village of Guinitan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 27 years old. Eusebia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Eusebia owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling green bananas & coconuts in the local community. Eusebia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Eusebia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eusebia is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas & coconuts. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Eusebia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas & coconuts.

location.town: Guinitan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Kalyibubu's Group

texts.en:
Kalyibubu is the leader of this group. She is 60 years old and married to a security guard. Together with her husband, she has raised six daughters and three sons. All the children are married and support their parents financially. 

Kalyibubu is engaged in cultivating agricultural products. This year she plans to grow wheat and potatoes, but she needs additional money in order to purchase fuel for field works. For this purpose, Kalyibubu applied for the loan. In the future she hopes to obtain a good harvest and gain a good profit from selling wheat and potatoes.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel.

loans.name: Elfego

texts.es:
El señor Elfego tiene ya mas de dos años dedicándose a la venta de ropa nueva, usada  afuera de su casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio ya que le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía que es ropa para hombre, juguetes, aparatos electrónicos y muebles, no cuenta con el capital necesario para la inversión y desea para su negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Elfego has been selling new and used clothing outside of his home for more than two years. He is requesting a loan so that he can invest in his business since he lacks a wide variety of merchandise such as men’s clothing, toys, electronics, and furniture. Elfego does not have the necessary capital to make the investment he desires for his business.

He plans to repay the loan using part of the earnings that is generated from his business, which is the source of income that supports his family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and other merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 43, is married to Francis, who is a carpenter, and they are blessed with seven children aged between 11 and 24. She practices dairy farming, which she has been doing for three years and earning a monthly income of KES 40,000.

This is her second loan with KADET LTD and she has a good credit history. She plans to use the loan amount to buy another dairy cow and boost her milk production to earn more income. Elizabeth intends to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and in the future hopes to be a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ageteraine Kidindimya Group

texts.en:
Joseph, 40, is married and the father of seven children. The family lives in a house in the Kyenjojo district of Uganda. He is a member of Ageteraine Kidindimya group in which each member guarantees the other members’ loan repayments.

Having started as a farmer, Joseph saved enough money to start up a barber shop that has grown over the past three years. He would like a loan to buy more barbering equipment for his shop.

Joseph’s dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more barbering equipment for his shop.

loans.name: Kamchibek

texts.en:
Kamchibek is 58 years old. He has three grown children – two sons and one daughter. 
In his area of the country, farming is one of the main activities, so Kamchibek decided to do this. He started his business in 2001 and managed to expand by renting land where he planted wheat. To broaden his business activities by breeding cattle, in 2009 he obtained his first loan of 80.000 KGS which was repaid without any delays. Today his farm has 35 sheep, 6 cows and one horse. 

Kamchibek plans to use this loan of 80,000 KGS to purchase more cattle. With the revenue, he wants to broaden his business activities. Kamchibek is a very positive and hard-working person who believes that his efforts will lead his family to a prosperous future. 


About Bai-Tushum:
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Barbra

texts.en:
Barbra is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala Central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Barbra has a business of a bridal care center, which she has had for six years.         

To help expand her business, Barbra has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase bridal dresses for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Barbra hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  

In the future, Barbra hopes to expand her business.  Barbra is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase bridal dresses for resale.

loans.name: Emerisa

texts.en:
Emerisa has a sari-sari (variety) store in front of her house. She sells soap, shampoo, toothpaste, biscuits and candies. She has three children to educate. While maintaining her business, she also does household chores. She usually earns about P4,000 and uses her profit as revolving capital in her retail store. Part of it also pays for daily meals and allowances for her children.

She wants to increase the capacity of sales and is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy soft drinks, breads, eggs and canned goods to sell in her store. This way, she can offer more products at her store and increase her earnings.
 
In the future, Emerisa wants to make frequent sales and earn consistent profits.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, breads, eggs and canned goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: Ana Elizabeth  D. 37 años D. edad, habita en su casa con su grupo familiar integrado por su madre, esposo y tres hijos. Ana es muy trabajadora y responsable quien se ha convertido en la principal proveedora económica dentro D. su hogar. Se dedica a la venta D. calzado, ropa y cosméticos.  Tiene muchos años D. dedicarse al mundo D. los negocios y gracias a su carisma cada vez los clientes son más. Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio, para así poder tener la oportunidad D. aspirar a una mejor calidad D. vida. Para esto ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con el objetivo D. comprar mercadería D. actualidad para su negocio, D. tal manera que los clientes siempre encuentren lo que buscan . Con el crédito quiere comprar variedad D. prendas D. vestir (calzado, blusas, vestidos, faldas, short, ropa interior, cosméticos, etc.) para estar un paso adelante D. la competencia. D. tal manera que en un futuro no lejano pueda lograr su sueño.
texts.en: Ana Elizabeth is 37 and lives in her home with her family, which is maD. up of her mother, husband, and 3 children.  Ana is very hard-working and has become the main economic provider for her home.  She sells shoes, clothing, and cosmetics.  She has many years of experience in the world of business, and thanks to her charisma, she gains more customers every day.  Her dream is to see her business grow so she can have the opportunity to aspire to a better quality of life.  This is why she has decided to request a loan from Integral with the objective of buying current merchandise for her business so her customers can always find what they are looking for.  With this loan, she will buy clothing (shoes, blouses, dresses, skirts, shorts, underwear, cosmetics, etc.) to be a step ahead of the competition.  In this way she will be able to achieve her dream in the not-so-distant future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing (shoes, blouses, dresses, skirts, shorts, underwear, cosmetics, etc.)

loans.name: Naome

texts.en:
Naome is 28 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past two years, Naome has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells sugar, soap, and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Naome has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from Kiva field partner BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar, soap, and cooking oil for resale, which she hopes will allow her to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for her family. Naome hopes that in the future she will be able to transform her shop from a retail business to a wholesale operation. 

Naome is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Naome who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Jacoba

texts.en:
Jacoba is a 48-year-old lady who is married to Nikson, a 68-year-old man. They have nine children, namely: Adrianus, 23, attending university; Maria, 19, graduated from senior high school; Carlos, 15, and Yani, 13, both studying at junior high school; Michele, 11, and Siwan, 10, both studying at primary school; Fitri, 9, studying in third grade of primary school; Jemris, 7, and Nova, 4, both not at school yet.

Jacoba works as a junk collector. She is assisted by her husband in collecting trash – such as copper, brass and plastic bottles – from the garbage dumps to be sold to her regular customers. From this business, Jacoba and her husband can generate enough income for their daily living. 

In order to improve her business, Jacoba is seeking a loan of 4,500,000 Indonesian rupiah from TLM. She wants to spend the loan on scrap metal and used plastic bottles in bulk from other junk collectors to be resold. She hopes that TLM will approve her application to support her in improving the business.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal and used plastic bottles in bulk

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 44-year-old woman who is married to a car retailer.
Samar was able to open a small food market (mini-market) in her neighborhood at the beginning of this year. She has been filling it with all the products that the customers in the area are asking for. For this reason, she has gained a respectable number of customers each day. Now Samar wants to expand her business and turn it into a supermarket by merging another store with hers and bringing in more variety to what she sells.

loans.use: to expand her business into a supermarket by merging with another store.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
La Sra. Esperanza tiene 58 años, y tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos ya están casados y formaron su propia familia y un hija de 25 años que le ayuda a atender el negocio y que esta realizando sus estudios para obtener el titulo de Despachante de Aduanas.
La sra. Esperanza tiene su despensa desde el año 2000 donde tambien vende comestibles y helados.La misma desea invertir en su negocio para que pueda seguir creciendo en el ámbito comercial.
Ella Solicitada el préstamo para la compra de azúcar,arroz, fideos, yerba y otros productos mas en forma mayorista, de esa manera obtendría un menor precio de compra y aumentaría sus ganancias por las ventas realizadas. También podrá tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 58 years old and has 4 children. Three of them are married and have started their own families, and her 25-year-old daughter helps her run the business and is studying to be a customs officer.
Esperanza has had a grocery store since 2000. She wants to invest in her business so it will keep growing commercially.
She is requesting this loan to buy sugar, rice, pasta, yerba mate, and other products in bulk. That way, she will get a better price and be able to increase her profits. She will also be able to offer her clients a wider variety of products.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, pasta, yerba mate, and other products.

loans.name: Virgen De La Candelaria Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formo con integrantes de otro comité que se disolvió. De esta forma se inicia el comité Virgen de la Candelaria. Actualmente está formado por 22 integrantes quienes trabajan de forma coordinada, siempre con miras a un objetivo común, se encuentran en el octavo ciclo del Programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
La Sra Graciela es una de las miembros, tiene 41 años está en pareja con el Señor Rogelio, quien es comerciante, tienen 2 hijas, una tiene 18 años y la otra 10 años, ambas están estudiando.
La Sra Graciela tiene una despensa en su domicilio particular, el cual le genera los ingresos necesarios para ayudar a su marido con la manutención de la casa y de los hijos. Comenta que tiene buenos ingresos, pues la mayoría de sus vecinos acuden a su negocio.
Ella pide la ayuda de Kiva y la fundación para cargar su negocio con productos de primera necesidad, como ser carnes, lácteos, panificados, azúcar, harina, pastas y otros.
texts.en:
The present communal bank was formed by members of another one that dissolved.  In this way the Virgen de la Candelaria communal bank began.  Currently there are 22 members who work in a coordinated fashion, always looking toward a common objective.  They are in the eighth loan cycle of the Programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras [Program of Women Entrepreneurs].

Graciela is one of the members.  She is 41 years old and lives as a couple with Rogelio, who is a businessman.  They have two daughters; one is 18 years old and the other 10, and both are students.

Graciela has a store in her private home that generates the necessary income to help her husband with the support of the household and the children.  She comments that she has a good income, since the majority of her neighbors come to her business.

She is requesting help from Kiva and the Fundación to stock her business with basic household necessities such as meat, dairy products, bread, sugar, flour, pasta, and other products.

loans.use: to buy meat, dairy products, bread, sugar, flour, pasta, and other products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 27 years. She is 50 years old and is married to Ng'ang'a, with whom she has two school going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan.  She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow as well as for labor purposes in her farm where she plants crops.

In the future, Mary hopes to expand her farming business and increase her income and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
This is Adelaida, 51, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Genaro, an employee, and father to her three children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Adelaida is a rice dealer. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the kilo. Aside from the rice, she also earns money by selling fruits. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 38,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fruits and sacks of rice for her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Adelaida hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week; there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of rice and fruit needed in her business.

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.ru: Мутабар занимается скотоводством. В основном она откармливает и продает скот. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Она берет кредит для закупа несколько голов бычков и телят.
texts.en: Mutabar practices animal husbandry. Generally she raises and then sells livestock. She is 39 years old, married, and has six children. She is incurring this debt in order to buy several head of young cattle.

loans.use: Buy several calves.

loans.name: Sébougou Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe  SÉBOUGOU sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans, et en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygamiques à SANOUBOUGOU I,  un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame  ASSETOU  en deuxième position à partir de la droite fait le commerce de pagnes et de pâte d’arachide.
Elle compte acheter  environ, 5 sacs d’arachides qu’elle transformera en pâte d’arachide pour les revendre en détail au grand marché de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Group Sébougou's six members are married women who are on average 27 years old with two children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Sanoubougou I, one of the popular districts of the city of Sikasso.
They are on their first loan with microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso; their objective is to meet their customers' expectations.
Mrs. Assetou, the second woman from the right, is in the trade of cloth and groundnut paste.
She is planning on purchasing about five bags of groundnuts to be processed into groundnut paste and retailed for cash at the great market in Sikasso and within the family circle, to a clientele mostly composed of women. 
She is counting on an average monthly profit of 15,000 FCFA, a part of which will be used to repay the loan with interest. The remainder will be saved.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts.

loans.name: Guadalupe Sellers Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, nothern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Guadalupe Sellers” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek loans of 500,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) each in order to invest in their businesses.

Mamanie, 33, is the leader of this group. She is married with six children – two in primary school, two in secondary school and one in college. Mamanie sells biscuits, sweets, milk, etc. and has been a businesswoman for five years. With the help of this loan, Mamanie will invest in her business by buying the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, sweets, milk, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: La socia Pualina, continua con su negocio de compra y venta de tarwi, la socia compra al por mayor y lo hace remojar y despues lo vende; la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de tarwi al por mayor para continuar con su negocio y de este modo seguir prosperando para a futuro viiver tranquila de sus ahorros. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de tarwi.
texts.en: Paulina continues working as a tarwi [lupin] merchant; she buys it at wholesale, soaks it and then resells it.  On this occasion she wants to use the loan to buy tarwi at wholesale to continue with her business and thus continue to make progress so that in the future she can live comfortably off her savings.  She requests the loan to buy tarwi.

loans.use: to buy tarwi [lupin].

loans.name: Abeba

texts.en: Abeba is married and has 3 children. For 5 years, she has cooked and sold banku (a dish of fermented corn or cassava) in Mbem near Abura. Her husband is a driver. Abeba uses her income to support her husband in paying their children's school fees. Abeba will use the loan to purchase maize in bulk for the preparation of her banku. With the new profits, Abeba plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase maize in bulk for the preparation of her banku.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a 61-year-old married woman in Kilifi. She is a dairy farmer and has been selling milk to her customers for the past 20 years with great success.

This is Dama’s second business loan from KADET Ltd. She plans to purchase more dairy cattle. 

She will use the anticipated profits to build herself a residential house. She hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more dairy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Julia wants to buy wants to buy packs of matchbox, soft drinks, sacks of sugar, maize, beans, boxes of flour, and cans of cooking fat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his clothes selling business

loans.name: Tetubo John

texts.en:
Born on October 10th, 1967, John is married and a father of five children. John lost both parents in a month and so hadn’t the opportunity to a good education. He has been challenged many times by sickness and armed robbers, which made him miserable. He then sought assistance from GHAPE and benefited from his first loan of $40 in 2004. From his previous loans, he has been able to meet the high demand of vegetables from his community. He has equally been able to meet some of the basic needs of his family.

With a loan of $700, John plans to buy a water pump and a sprayer, since his garden is expanding and manual watering is becoming inefficient. He plans to repay the loan in 18 months. The first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement.

loans.use: purchase of a water pump and sprayer

loans.name: Agossi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Agossi A., age 37, is married to a farmer with whom she had seven (07) children. Their very limited earnings do not meet the needs of the family. Her meager income is due to the sale of only one type of fish. The family's precarious situation prevents the schooling of the children.

To improve her commercial situation, she had obtained a loan which she was able to pay back in time. At present, in order to go herself to Ghana to buy different types of fish, she requests once again a loan of $400. The profit drawn will be used for schooling the children which is her major concern.

Translated from French by Stephane Mortier , Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 37 ans, Madame A. Agossi est mariée à un cultivateur avec qui elle a eu sept (07) enfants. Leurs revenus très insuffisants ne couvrent pas les besoins de la famille. La vente d’un seul type de poisson justifie la faiblesse de son revenu. Cette situation très précaire de la famille empêche la scolarisation des enfants.

Pour améliorer sa situation commerciale, elle avait obtenu un crédit qu’elle a su remboursé à temps. A présent, pour aller elle-même au Ghana acheter les différents types de poissons, elle sollicite encore une fois, un crédit de $400. Le profit tiré servira à la scolarisation des enfants qui est son souci majeur.

loans.use: Commerce in fish

loans.name: Hidayet

texts.en: Hidayet is an Internally Displaced Person from the Gubadli district .He is married, has 2 children. He started his business in 2004. His business is located in front of his hostel. He has applied for his first loan and wants to borrow 700$ from Normicro. He wants to buy a fridge for his business to store inventory. He believes by buying this asset he will drammatically improve his business turnover.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in merchandise (metallic and plastic containers for water)

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah A. is happily married with five children. She is 38 years old and comes from Ajamgbandin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She grinds pepper, tomatoes and beans for people living in her community. She has been in this business since 1997 and she is in need of a loan of $450 to buy bathing slippers to add to her shop to sell. She said it will enable her to add an additional source of income.

loans.use: Hannah would like to buy bathroom slippers to sell.

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
I have owned a beauty salon for over two years. This is my family’s sole source of income, and I am taking care of my mother, who also works at the salon. We are in need of merchandise and equipment. We are requesting $1,000.00 USD in order to buy beauty salon equipment and merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo un negocio de salón de belleza tengo ya mas de 2 años con mi negocio. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia ya que tengo a mi cargo a mi mama ella también trabaja en el negocio. Nos esta haciendo falta mercancía y unos equipos de belleza. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls. para la compra de mercancía y equipo para el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of beauty salon equipment and merchandise

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita began selling cakes and jellies from the door of her house. Gradually, her business began to grow and she converted it into a store. Nevertheless, her desire to work and get ahead motivated her to sell chicken soup and “picarones” (a dessert) at night in her neighborhood and sell “causa” (a typical Lima dish) at the gate of the National Stadium on the weekends. Thanks to her efforts, Margarita has been able to get her seven children ahead and improve their living situation. In addition, she has been able to help her sister, Delfina, take care of her two children since her husband became ill. As the start high school classes approaches, Margarita would like to take advantage of this opportunity to sell school supplies. For this, she estimates that she needs 500 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Margarita comenzó vendiendo kekes y gelatinas en la puerta de su casa; de a pocos su negocio fue creciendo y se convirtió en una tienda. Sin embargo, sus ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, hicieron que vendiera por las noches caldo de gallina y picarones (dulce limeño) en su barrio y los fines de semana, causa (platillo típico limeño) en la puerta del Estadio Nacional. Gracias a su empeño, Margarita ha podido sacar adelante a sus 7 hijos y mejorar su vivienda. Además, ha podido ayudar a su hermana Delfina a cuidar a sus 2 hijos, pues su esposo se encuentra mal de salud. Al acercarse el inicio de clases en los colegios, Margarita quisiera aprovechar esta oportunidad para vender artículos escolares. Para ello estima que necesita 500 soles.

loans.use: Expand her business.

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Mrs. Ya F., 52 years old, is a cake seller in the Bei Village in the Chrung Comres I Sangkat in Phnom Penh City. She takes care of eleven children and earns about $3 a day. Her husband, Mr. Rim Ly, is a 59-year-old motorcycle taxi driver who earns about $2 a day. Her son, Mr.Ly Smeanglor, a bricklayer, and her daughter, Ms. Ly Mari, a garment worker, earn about $2 a day each. The other children are students. She previously successfully concluded a loan with HKL.

To increase income for her family, she is now requesting a loan of $1000 to expand her inventory of cakes. This loan will also help to pay for her children’s school fees and daily living expenses.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of cakes for sale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
The general store that Maria runs everyday from morning to night has been in operation for a year. Before starting the store, she worked as a street vendor, selling sneakers. For six years, she maD. her way around different markets to sell them. Before that, she used to work in a commercial area until street vendors were forced out.

When her son suggested that she open a shop, she decided to stop selling shoes and, with her family's support, open a general store. Her son loaned her money and her daughters help her tend and manage the store. In the future, Maria would like to increase her sales and grow her business. Happily, she can count on the help of her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La bodega que María maneja a diario desD. la mañana hasta la noche tiene un año D. inaugurada. Antes D. dedicarse a este negocio ella vendía zapatillas como ambulante. Durante seis años visito distintos mercados con tal D. vender. Los años anteriores vendía en un centro comercial hasta que desalojaron a los ambulantes.

Una vez que su hijo le propuso abrir una tienda, ella se decidió por dejar la venta D. zapatos y D. inmediato, con el apoyo D. su familia abrió la bodega. Su hijo le prestó el capital y sus hijas la ayudan con la atención D. la bodega y el mantenimiento. Más adelante María quisiera aumentar sus ventas y crecer en su negocio, felizmente cuenta con la ayuda D. sus hijas.

loans.use: Add merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Consuelo Inocenta

texts.en:
Consuelo Inocenta G. T. has a general store in the town of Salpo high in the sierras of the La Libertad Region. She has over 30 years of business experience. Her store is located in the center of town so she has many customers. She sells rice, sugar, soda, juices, and much more.

Consuelo is 48 years old and married with 4 children. All her children study and are planning on becoming professionals. She is happy to have her business; it has given her some independence and confidence.

A member of the community bank Virgen de Las Mercedes, Consuelo is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to restock her store with all the products her clients love.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her store with all the products her clients love.

loans.name: Shohsanam

texts.en:
A. Shohsanam is a 27 year old lady. Shohsanam is the loving mother of two children, whom she is raising alone. Shohsanam is working hard in order to provide her kids with all they need, and also to pay for their education. In order to support her family, Shohsanam has been running her own business for 4 years already.

In the local market, she has been selling clothing for kids. Shohsanam is very successful in her business, considering that this is the only source of income for the family.

Shohsanam has previously been provided with loans by IMON, having a positive credit history without any violations. Today, Shohsanam requests $600 US, as this courageous woman plans to use the loan for increasing the range of goods and improving the lives of her children. She is promising to repay the loan in 4 months and thanks everyone for trusting and supporting her.

loans.use: Purchasing of new goods in order to increase the range of goods and improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua is 51 years old, and the widowed mother of four children. She has been selling farm produce in the local market for over 20 years. Due to a low income, she has not been able to give an education to all her children.
