Afua would like to request a loan in order to sustain her business, and finance an education for the youngest of her two children and ensure a bright future for them.

Afua is also a member of a group called Isaiah. Members support one another in repaying loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize and plantain

loans.name: Mariva

texts.en:
Mariva is married and has two children ,10 and 18. She started selling clothes in 2001. Every day, she works from 7 am to 8 pm and earns about $70 each month.

Mariva is aksing for a loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hotel And Cafe Group

texts.en:
Khursheed baji is a wife of G. F. and lives in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical and pious places. She has been living in this city for the last 8 years. She is the mother of one son named Imran. Imran is 20 years old and runs his hotel, where he sells different types of Punjabi foods (Samosas, Pakoras). He started this business when he was just 15. Her husband is a daily wage labor. Khursheed baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy material (cooking oil, utensils) to expand her son's food business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. G. Fatima baji wants a loan to buy goats to resell. Kanizan baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. Sultana baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Ghafooran baji and Rubina baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for their milk businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy goods for making and selling food

loans.name: Hydnius

texts.en: Hydnius N. is 44 years old and is married with 2 children. His eldest child is in a public secondary school while his youngest child is in primary school. Hydnius is a hardworking man. He sews women's bags and wallets. He has one sewing machine that he uses to sew the bags and wallets. When he finishes sewing the bags and wallets, he takes them to Oba, New Benin, Oregbeni and Ekiosa markets for sale. Hydnius says this business is very good because he gets high patronage from women. He buys the leather and zippers from Aba market in the eastern part of Nigeria. His greatest challenge is that there is no constant electricity supply, so he cannot meet the demands of his customers. He hopes for the loan amount of $450 to buy one generator set and leather for the production of women's bags.

loans.use: To purchase more leathers for the production of female bags and to buy a generator set

loans.name: Mrs. Phouk An Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phouk A. is a group leader of four, who all live in Pun Phnum Village in Takeo Province. She owns a hectare plot of land where she cA. cultivate rice to earn a living. In her plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile, which has a bad effect on her crop. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Phouk A. decided to ask for a loA. to buy fertilizers to support her crop to make it more productive. Her husband, Mr. Nu Veasna, is a construction worker who cA. earn a small income to support his family. Mrs. Phouk A. is 34 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is at the age of four years.

Mrs. Moeu M. did not come to accept the loA., but her husband did so he is present in the picture.

All the members in this group loA. have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loA. until the very end of the loA. term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loA. term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her crop to make it more productive.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. has been selling fried fish and yam at Tetermu near Elmina since 2003. Victoria has received Junior high education. She is a single parent with two children and she is responsible for paying her children's school fees, utility bills and other expenses. Her loan will be used to buy fresh fish and yams for frying and then resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in the expansion of the business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy fresh fish and yams for frying and then resale.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a member of the Luz y Vida (“Light and Life”) Village Bank. Edith is 24 years old and lives with her partner; they are currently expecting their first child. Edith sells wood to carpentry workshops. Her father sends her the wood in the family car from the Ayacuchan jungle, where he lives. Edith needs a loan to 750 soles to buy wood. Edith dreams of buying a bigger car to transport her products and of finishing her studies to get her degree as an Executive Secretary.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Edith es socia del Banco Comunal Luz y Vida.

Edith es conviviente, tiene 24 años y esta esperando su primer hijo, Edith vende madera, lo ofrece a carpinterías, las maderas son enviadas por su papa que vive en la selva ayacuchana, lo transportan con carro propio.

Edith necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera.

Edith sueña con comprar un carro mas grande para transportar sus productos y terminar de estudiar su carrera de secretariado ejecutivo.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Amirjon

texts.en:
Amirjon A. applied to MicroInvest for the first time in 2006 and since that time he has been an active client of our program. Amirjon trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure and he is a reliable client. He started the business from scratch but today he has an outlet and business selling fabric.

Amirjon lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 2 children. He is a young father who works hard to ensure a good future for his children. Amirjon works with direct suppliers and sometimes he goes to buy goods to Uzbekistan. He has been in this business for 6 years. Mr. Amirjon A. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 4000 STJ for 9 months to import popular fabrics to increase his business turnover.

loans.use: to import popular fabrics for re-sale

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua A., a 65-year-old farmer and merchant, is married with six kids. For lack of funds she could not help any of her children to attend senior high school. Akosua lives with her husband in a village called Koforidua in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is farmer who farms food crops like yams, maize, plantains, and cassava and retails them at the community market during market days. For most of her life she has been selling bananas. She uses the proceeds from her crop to purchase a bulk supply of bananas for re-sale. Akosua has been farming for the past 45 years.

She is requesting a loan to enable her to buy increased stocks of bananas, agro-chemicals and fertilizer to grow her business and scale up sales. She says her major challenge has to do with the future. She hopes to increase her savings to help her children continue their education.

Akosua believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to help her husband provide food and finance her dear children's education. Akosua belongs to a village bank called ‘Awurade aye’ which means "God has done it". She hopes to receive GHS 500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy increased supply of bananas, agro-chemicals and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Leonarda

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora María Leonarda le esta hacienda falta un cuarto, ella es madres soltera y  tiene solo un hijo que ya es mayor de edad y le ayuda en los gastos de la casa.
     Doña María Leonarda con mucho esfuerzo ya compro el block pero le falta la varilla, cemento y pagar la mano de obra, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder llevar acabo su mejora ya que la recamara es para su hijo que necesita su propio espacio. 
Planea pagar esté crédito con los ingresos que obtiene como limpieza de una casa particular.
texts.en:
Ms. María Leonarda's home needs an additional room. María is a single mother of one son, who is now an adult and helps her with the costs of keeping a home. María has already purchased the cement blocks, but she needs the rods, cement, and money to pay for labor. She is asking for a loan to cover these costs, so that she can finish the home improvement and provide her son with his own space. She plans to repay this loan with income from cleaning a private home.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Begin construction of an additional room

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.en:
K. Sobirjon is 42 years old and the father of 3 children who are all attending the local school. His wife is a housekeeper. Sobirjon owns a 0.5-hectare field for cultivating rice in order to earn for living. On this plantation, Sobirjon now cannot do any planting because he does not have enough money for rice seeds. In order to deal with this problem, he decided to ask for a loan of 2500 Somoni to buy rice seeds to cultivate. He will use the rest of the loan to purchase fertilizers and fuel to support his field. Sobirjon counts on this opportunity to obtain a better yield, in order to improve the living conditions of his family.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase seed, fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Verena

texts.en:
Greetings from Verena M. in Kigali, Rwanda!  Verena is requesting her third loan from Vision Finance Company.  She would like a loan of 300,000 Rwandan Francs so that she can buy more inventory for her general store.  She will pay it back on a monthly basis over a period of 8 months.  

Verena has owned her shop for ten years.  She employs one person to help her to run it, and she works daily from 7:00am to 7:30pm.  She is 32 years old and married with two children and she cares for two additional dependents.  She plans to use her profits to reinvest in her business so that it can continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop

loans.name: Fialauia

texts.en:
Fialauia M., 39, is married with 4 children. She has 2 years of experience in the Elei business. She sells retail to the village people 5 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1570 Tala.

She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Fialauia’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase materials for her business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John M. works as a driver and a mechanic at Moree near Cape Coast, which he has done since 2003. He is married with eight dependents and has received an education through senior high school. While John works as a driver, his wife makes her living as a fishmonger. He is responsible for paying for utilities, food, and his children’s school fees.

John’s loan will be used to purchase an engine for his car and he hopes to use the new profits from his business to expand his enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase an engine for his car

loans.name: Gwendolyn

texts.en:
Gwendolyn T. is from the village of Eastern Poblacion. She is 49 years old. Gwendolyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gwendolyn harvests and sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. Gwendolyn has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Gwendolyn joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gwendolyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Gwendolyn is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Gwendolyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Dilshodchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Дилшодчон Зикруллоева услышав от односельчан о нашей организации, обратилась к нам за помощью. После одобрения всей ее документации она получила кредит и потратила его на  изготовление и продажу лепешек.  Получив хорошие доходы, она подала повторную заявку на получения кредита, но уже для закупа  2 ягнят .
Дилшодчон параллельно с бизнесом по изготовлению лепешек  занимается животноводством. Откармливает скот и продает его на рынке. Стаж работы в сфере животноводческой деятельности у нее 15 лет. В этом бизнесе ей помогает муж Бахрулло. У Дилшодчон и Бахрулло 2 детей.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

When Dilshodchon Zikrulloeva heard of our organization from her fellow villagers she has come to ask for help. After the approval of all her documents she received a loan and spent it on production of flat breads. After making good profit she has applied for another loan but this time for purchase of two young sheep. Dilshodchon is running an animal husbandry business parallel to the flat bread production. She feeds the cattle and sells it on the market. She has fifteen years of experience in the animal husbandry field. Her husband Bahrullo helps her with this business. Dilshodchon and Bahrullo have two children.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two sheep

loans.name: Ndi

texts.en:
Born on the 16th of April in 1982, E. is single with two children below the age of fifteen. She lives at Mile 90 Nsongwa Mezam Division, Bamenda, Cameroon. She is a very hard-working young lady. Though she did not make it through school, she is still determined to succeed in life and to provide for her children what her parents could not do for her. Given her fourth loan, she plans to invest in opening a restaurant. More specifically, she will buy foodstuffs like beans, corn and vegetables to cook and sell. Experience has taught her how to manage a business like this one. Her business site is located in a very good area. Food-selling is in high demand in the locality where she stays.

E. loves GHAPE because of the low interest and the social interactions among members. These interactions bolster her loan utilization and management.   

 The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase black and red beans, groundnuts, fertilizer, manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in the agricultural work

loans.name: Sokly Heng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sokly H. is 31 years old and is the president of the village bank responsible for this 15-person loan. All loan recipients live in Chheu Teal village in Takeo province, and they will use the loan for various purposes. 

Sokly H. is a silk weaver. She decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk to weave, since her current business is doing well. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better life for her family. Her husband, Pon Theourn, is a corn farmer in the local village. They have one child who attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave.

loans.name: Isis Lisseth

texts.es: Isis Lisseth A. D. P. vive en el municipio D. Apopa en el departamento D. San Salvador. A  su temprana edad D. 19 años, Isis abrió su propio negocio, una tienda D. cosméticos y ropa. Al principio no fu fácil, pues la juventud y la falta D. preparación  no combinan bien. A pesar D. sus limitaciones. Isis cuenta con una enorme cualidad, siempre ha sido emprendedora, y después D. 7 años manejando el negocio ha logrado hacerla crecer cada vez un poco más. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar nuevos productos y surtir su  preciado negocio.
texts.en:
Isis Lisseth A. D. P. lives in the town of Apopa in the district of San Salvador. At the tender age of 19, Isis opened her own business selling cosmetics and clothing. At first it was not easy since youth and a lack of preparation make for a bad combination. Despite these limitations, Isis demonstrated her enterprising spirit and has managed to grow her business gradually over the span of 7 years. She is currently requesting a loan to buy new products in order to stock her precious business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lam

texts.en:
Lam T. N. was born in 1952 ( id: 010117090047 ) lives in Dai Bi, Uy No, which is southeast of Dong Anh in the Red River Delta region north of Ha Noi. Her family includes her son and daughter-in-law, both of whom work, and two grandsons.Mrs Lam grows rice and raises pigs. In her free time, she looks for work. Her family has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 VND. 

Mrs Lam is one of a five-member group requesting a loan from SEDA. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND (about 300 USD) to buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy food for her pigs

loans.name: Torn

texts.en: Mrs. Torn N. lives in Trapaing Trayoeung village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Pech Nouy, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income to support their household. In order to reach the living, Mrs. Torn N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to be motor taxi driver. She is 37 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others two are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right of photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to be motor taxi driver.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy C. est une femme de 63 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont les 2 fréquentent l'école. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE depuis 1 an et demi et y a bénéficié de 3 prêts. cette fois-ci elle sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra de poursuivre son activité de vente de poisson séché afin de se procurer des bénéfices qui l'aideront à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amy C. is a 63 year old woman, married, and a mother of four children, of whome two are currently in school. She has been a member of the village bank named TENGHORY DIAMALAYE for the past year and a half and has benefitted from three loans. She is asking for another loan to enable her to strengthen her retail activity of selling dried fish. She will use the profits to help support her family.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her retail activity of selling dried fish

loans.name: Alice Nelima

texts.en:
Alice is 32 years old, married and is blessed with four children. She has been a butcher for the past four years. Her business is located at Kona and her major clients are residents of Matunda, Kona and Brigadier (within Matunda) in Eldoret.

She was introduced to KADET by a neighbour. With the loan she is taking from KADET she intends to buy a cow to butcher. Her dreams are to grow her business, be able to improve her living stanadards and to educate her children.

About KADET:  The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: http://www.kadet.co.ke/

loans.use: To buy a cow to slaughter and sell at her butcher shop

loans.name: Juliaca

texts.es:
Juliana es mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, tiene 30 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos, con los que vive en su casa propia.

Hace 10 años sembró sus plantas de café y plátanos en sus propias chacras y ahora se está dedicando a quitar las malas hierbas y la maleza que crece alrededor de sus cultivos. Estos trabajos las realiza con mucho esmero y cariño, pues generalmente trabaja con su esposo, y para las cosechas sus hijos también se suman a la recolección, pues solo trabajando de esta forma logran recolectar varios quintales en un día, lo cual le es muy beneficioso para ellos.
Una vez preparada la carga la transportan en carro (dos horas de camino) hasta la ciudad para venderlas a las acopiadoras. Con estas ganancias, Juliana y su familia tienen una economía estable, por ello sus anhelos son de de incrementar este cultivo (café) y mejorar su calidad de vida.  

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, donde muestra mucha gratitud, ya que para ella estos créditos son de gran utilidad, por lo que no piensa defraudar la confianza. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Juliana is a simple, hard-working woman. She is 30 years-old, married, and has two children, and lives with her family in their own house. Ten years ago Juliana first planted her crops of coffee and plantains on her own fields, and now she is working to remove the weeds and bad plant growth that are growing around her lands. Juliana does these tasks gladly and with lots of care, as she usually works alongside her husband and her children also help out with the harvest. Just working this way the family can harvest several quintals a day, which is very beneficial for them. Once the load is prepared, it is transported in car (two hours traveling) to the city to sell it to the collection plants. With these earnings, Juliana and her family have a stable income. Juliana wishes to increase their crops of coffee and improve their quality of life. This is Juliana's second loan with MFP. She is very grateful for the opportunity, as these loans are of great use to her, and would never betray the institution's trust. The funds from this loan will be invested in the purchase of chemical fertilizers for the coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Iqbol's Group

texts.en:
Iqbol, the leader of this group, comes from the rural town of Kant. After the collapse of the Soviet Union, most of the industrial factories stopped working, and there was little opportunity to work for the government. Alert people switched to commerce. They started to trade in various goods or opened their own businesses. Lots of people have gone abroad in search of work. Iqbol has been lucky, since she and her husband stayed in the city. They have been able to make their living in Kant.

Her husband is a builder. They are raising five children. The eldest daughter is thirteen, and the smallest son is just a year and half. Iqbol inherited a trade from her parents, making flat cakes. She invested $23 and started selling flat cakes at home. It has been six years since she started, and now she has a net profit of $95 a month.

Iqbol’s elder daughter helps her look after the little kids and also helps her knead dough. Her husband helps her buy and transport flour. Sometimes her children stay outside with Iqbol and help her sell the flat cakes.

Currently, Iqbol needs a loan to purchase three sacks of flour, salt and yeast for baking flat cakes. She has big plans for expanding her business and helping her children get an education and get on their feet. Iqbol’s group partners: Zebiniso, 38, is a builder’s wife. She has six children. Zebiniso and her husband have recently collected beet crops. They also keep hens and sell eggs. They need a loan to buy a cow, so that they do not have to buy milk for their children. Mukimjon, 48, trades in vegetables: potatoes, beets and radishes. He has three children. Mukimjon hopes to provide them with a good education and wants his daughters to marry. Mukimjon needs a loan to invest in purchasing vegetables wholesale. Salomat, 43, has four children. Her husband works as a builder. Salomat bakes and sells flat cakes. She hopes to obtain a loan to buy several sacks of flour. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for flat cakes

loans.name: Noelia

texts.es:
A sus 31 años de edad, la dama Noelia C. trabaja arduamente para beneficiar a sus hijos con un lugar digno donde vivir y para ello ha iniciado a repellar las paredes de su vivienda y también a pintarlas para que su casa se vea diferente y así sus hijos se sientan satisfechos con su madre.

Es por este motivo que solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la pintura ya que ella misma se está encargando de pintar para así continuar brindándole a sus hijos excelentes condiciones para vivir en un lugar que preste las condiciones necesarias.
texts.en:
Noelia C., 31, works very hard for the benefit of her children, providing them with a worthy place to live. She has begun to replaster and repaint the walls of her house so that it will look different and her children will be proud of their mother. She is requesting funds to buy paint which she, herself, will apply to the walls in order to continue to provide her children with excellent living conditions and to live in surroundings that have the necessary conditions for this.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paint.

loans.name: Kamamemi Group

texts.en: Makaprr Koroma is approximately forty-seven years old. She is the leader of this group called Kamamemi (a Temne phrase meaning “Give me a try”). She and her fellow group members are small-scale businesswomen in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone who want a loan of SLL 500,000 each to boost their businesses. The group’s leader, Makaprr is married with three children; one of her children is attending secondary school and two are in college. Makaprr sells market food – palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), rice and many more items. She has been in this business for many years.  With her share of this loan, she will add more stock to her business; she will specifically buy a bag of peppers, a bag of rice, onions, tomatoes, margi, and a bag of salt.

loans.use: Buy a bag of peppers, a bag of rice, onions, tomatoes, margi, and a bag of salt

loans.name: Mercy Joy's Group

texts.en:
Mercy Joy U. is from the village of Villa Domingo, Angadanan, Isabela. She is 44 years old. Mercy Joy is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mercy Joy is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mercy Joy owns and operates a business venture raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Mercy Joy has been engaged in her business for over ten years, and she earns approximately 20000 PHP every four months.

In 2009, Mercy Joy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercy Joy is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Mercy Joy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI: 
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for breeding

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael is 34 years old and a mother of three children, the youngest of whom is just 13 months old. Rachael's husband sells lubricants to support the home while Rachael sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. Before now, she hawked cooked foods from one place to another. However, with a loan from Kiva partner, LAPO, she was then able to get a stall and sell foodstuffs. Rachael opens her stall daily from 8am to 6pm. She is now requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to expand her business. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and to LAPO.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Carlos Rigoberto

texts.en:
Carlos lives in a cement house, in Guayaquil, with water and electricity. He is 46 and married, but his wife lives in Spain. Together they have three children: 24, 22, and 14 years old, the youngest of whom attends high school. Carlos used to work as a collector for a department store, but decided to start his own business running a small store, where he sells products on credit.

Carlos´ son helps him in the store and also goes around town collecting payments from customers from 9:00 am to 7:00 pm. One difficulty that Carlos has is that the area is not safe, and there are many thieves he has to protect his business from.

With the loan, Carlos is planning to buy sheets, clothes, and food to sell in his store. In the future he would like to have more products in the store and to be able to expand the customer base of those paying with credit.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his store (clothes, sheets, and food)

loans.name: Tomas Paipe

texts.pt:
Tomas Paipe S. nasceu no Distrito de Mabote, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique tem 48 anos de idade casado e pai de 2 filhos de 6 e 4 anos de idade, o primeiro vai a escola. Fez somente 7ą classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo quando vinha cumprir com o serviço militar obrigatório, acabando fixando sua residência neste local. Ė pensionista do Ministério da Defesa há mais de 18 anos, tem uma pensão mensal de 3.397.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algo dez enquanto.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de outros amigos que são clientes desta instituição. Este é 5º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia e outros) para ampliar a sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 2.500.00mt, 5.000.00mt, 5.000.00mt e 5.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.
No futuro deseja solicitar mais empréstimo para concluir a sua casa e iniciar uma actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Tomas Paipe S. was born in the district of Mabote, in the province of Inhambane in the south of Mozambique. He is 48 years old, married, and has 2 children who are 6 and 4 years old. The 6 year old attends school. Tomas only studied through 7th grade, and didn't continue because of a lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home with his family and isn't responsible for supporting anyone else financially. Tomas left Inhambane for Maputo when he went to fulfill the obligatory military service, and ended up staying there. He has received a pension from the Ministry of Defense for the past 18 years. His monthly pension is 3397.00 Meticales, which he uses to cover household expenses. He is sometimes able to save some money in his bank account. Tomas has never taken out a loan with another bank. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through friends who work with the institution. This is his 5th loan, for the amount of 15,000.00 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, iron, sand and other items) in order to expand his house. His earlier loans were for 2500.00, 5000.00, 5000.00, and 5000.00 Meticales, and all were used for the same purpose. In the future he would like to apply for more loans to finish his house and to start a business.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand and other items)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more feed for his animals

loans.name: Heyssell Sarai

texts.es:
la sra. Heyssell V. se dedica a la venta de comida en su casa de habtacion, esta soltera y es muy dedicada a sus estudios y a su negocio, Heyssell se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para preparar sus deliciosas comidas   y a las 5 de la mañana ya esta vendiendo. Vive  con sus papas y la apoyan con su negocio y sus estudios.
el prestamo lo nesecita para comprar carnes ya que tiene mas demanda en estos dias.
las ganancias las utilizara para ayudar a sus padres y pagar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Heyssell V. sells prepared meals in her home. She is single and very dedicated to her studies and her business. Heyssell rises at 4am every day to prepare her delicious meals and is open for business by 5am. She lives with her parents and they support her work and study efforts. She needs funding to buy meats because they are in high demand these days. She will use her profits to help her parents pay for her schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beef, pork and chicken.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is 22 years old and engaged to be married. He works as a master mason and builder. There is a lot of competition in this type of business, but he is known for being a hard worker and for his quality work. More importantly, he knows how to satisfy his clients’ demands. With this loan, Mohamad will replace his work tools and be able to offer better service and, as a consequence, gain a larger clientele. This is his second loan from our institution. He has shown good compliance in paying off his previous loan. He plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase new tools.

loans.name: Jacqueline Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jacqueline de 38 años de edad es casada, tiene  3 hijos, Grethel de 20 años la cual es casada, Axel de 19 años estudiando en la universidad el 3er año de Ing. Agroindustrial y Jacqueline de 18 años que tambien ya esta casada. Doña Jacqueline es pequeña comerciante de electrodomesticos y administra su propio negocio llamado "Distribuidora del Hogar".  

Gracias a un proyecto de vivienda Jacqueline obtuvo la oportunidad de tener su casa, la cual esta pagando con cuotas mensuales, y esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de ampliar su casa, construyendo 2 cuartos para brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, ya que sus hijos viven con ella.  

El mayor deseo que tiene es poder tener una casa bonita y con las condiciones necesarias para que su familia se sienta comoda.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 38 years old, married, and has three children. Grethel is 20 years old and married. Axel is 19 years old and a third year university student studying agro-industrial engineering. Jacqueline is 18 years old and is also married. Doña Jacqueline is a small businesswoman who sells household appliances and manages her own business called “Home Distributor”.

Thanks to the assistance of a housing program, Jacqueline had the opportunity to buy a house and now pays a monthly mortgage. She is requesting her first loan in order to expand her house by building two rooms that will help her family be more comfortable since her children still live with her.

Her greatest wish is to have a beautiful house with all the necessary comforts that will help her family feel at home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build two additional rooms for her house

loans.name: María Albertina

texts.es:
María Albertina tiene 49 años D. edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el sector Cruz del Médano, uno D. los caseríos mas grandes del distrito D. Mórrope, caracterizado por tener a la mayoría D. su población agrupada en zonas rurales que distan mucho una D. la otra. Pertenece a la provincia D. Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercio D. animales menores desD. hace mas D. tres años. Ella cría aves D. corral y ovejas en corrales ubicados cerca D. su domicilio, les brinda una alimentación balanceada y cuando estos ya ha alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona con cierta frecuencia para adquirir animales que luego venderán en el mercado Moshoqueque D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

María trata D. mantener su negocio para seguir percibiendo ingresos que le permitan ayudar a su esposo con la economía familiar. Actualmente ella desea adquirir mas animales para criarlos y venderlos, así como alimento balanceado para mejorar su calidad y percibir mas ganancias, siguiendo su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer activa que comparte su tiempo entre las actividades D. ama D. casa y en el cuidado D. sus animales. Su mayor anhelo es contribuir al mejoramiento D. la calidad D. vida D. su familia. En la zona donD. vive sus vecinos la estiman mucho y la consideran una mujer responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
María Albertina is 49 years old, married and has two children. They live together as a family in Cruz del Médano, one of the largest hamlets in the district of Mórrope, which is known for having the majority of its population clustered in rural areas very distant from one another. María lives about an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo in the province of Lambayeqye. She has maD. a living raising and selling small animals for more than three years. She raises poultry and sheep in pens near her home, providing them a balanced diet, and when they have reached a good level of development she puts them up for sale to the business people who visit the area with some frequency to acquire animals to then sell in the Moshoqueque market in Chiclayo. María tries to keep her business going so she can continue earning income to help her husband with the family finances. Currently, she wishes to acquire more animals to raise for sale, as well as balanced feed to improve their quality and increase their value, which is why for the first time she is requesting a loan of 1000 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa. María is an active women who divides her time between her household chores and caring for her animals. Her biggest goal is to contribute to the improvement of her family's quality of life. She is held in high esteem by her neighbors in the area and they consider her a responsible and hard-working woman.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals and feed

loans.name: Roeun's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thoeun Sim, age 31, is the leader of this group loan having been selected by its four members who all live in Peam Reang Leu village in Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses. Mrs. Thoeun Sim is a pig breeder and her husband Mr. Sokhorn Try is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice.  These businesses provide a small income to support the family.  Mrs. Thoeun Sim will use the loan to buy piglets for breeding and pig food. This couple has two children. One is a student in the local school and the other, age 4, is not yet in school.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Irene

texts.fr:
jeune commercante de 39 ans, celibataire avec 1 enfant a sa charge, s'est lancee dans la vente des tissus a la fin de ses etudes au lycee, n'ayant pas de moyens pour payer ses etudes universitaires et ses parents etant morts, avec une somme de 30000frs  en 1999, elle achete quelques rouleaux de popeline et trouve un etalage au marche de moungali specialise dans la vente des tissus de qualite.
Elle vend en moyenne 20000f a 35000frs par jour et s'approvisionne dans les grands depots de la place,les commercants de Cotonou, de la Chine et de Kinshasa.
Avec l'octroi du pret elle compte acheter des tissus de qualite comme la soie,satin, velours,super 100, ergonza,popeline et tous les tissus a la mode.
Elle use de beaucoup de strategies pour faire croitre son activite,comme preter des tissus aux femmes  en bon dans des administrations,et jouer avec les prix et trouver des tissus a la mode a tout saison.

Tres connue dans son milieu,elle est tres ouverte et souriante avec ses clientes;dans peu de temps elle pense a ouvrir un grand magassin des tissus.
texts.en:
39 years young business person. Single with 1 child in her care. She embarked on the sale of fabrics at the end high school. Not having means to pay for university, her parents having died. With a sum of 30000 Francs in 1999, she bought some poplin rolls and got a display space in the market of Moungali specializing in the sale of fabrics of quality. She sells on average 20000frs to 35000frs per day and gets her supply in the large warehouses of the place. The traders of Cotonou, China and Kinshasa. With the loan she intends to buy fabrics of quality like silk, satin, velvet, super 100, ergonza, poplin and all the high fashion fabrics. She uses many strategies to grow her business, like lending fabrics to women in good standing, and is flexible with prices and tries to find fabrics in fashion at any season. Well known in her milieu, she is very open and smiling with her customers; soon she thinks to open a fabric department store.

Translated from French by Mark Latour, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rolls of quality fabrics like silk, satin, velvet, super 100, ergonza, poplin

loans.name: Lourdes Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Lourdes L. es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y reside en el Barrio Oriental en Danli, El Paraiso.

Doña Lourdes se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de comidas y golosinas como ser: enchiladas, chilaquiles, baleadas, tortillas con quesillo, catrachitas, yuca con chicharron, tacos, refresco de botellas y agua natural. Doña Lourdes tiene un año de haber iniciado con este tipo de negocio y es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar eficientemente. 

El lugar donde se encuentra ubicado su negocio es muy apto para este tipo de actividad ya que es la única caseta que funciona dentro del establecimiento donde estan las oficinas de Recursos Naturales, de la ciudad de Danlí, lugar donde también se encuentran las Oficinas de la SAG, SENASA, PRALEBAH, PROHECO y la Dirección Distrital de Educación. La mayoría de sus clientes son empleados de las instituciones antes descritas, y muchos empleados consumen los alimentos al crédito y le pagan cuando reciben sus respectivos salarios. 
Cabe  mencionar que también tiene clientes de las zonas rurales o personas que visitan estas oficinas ya que son oficinas de bastante trámite para las personas que viven cerca del casco urbano. 

Doña Lourdes utilizara el credito para comprar los insumos necesarios para la fabricacion de los diferentes platos que ofrece en su negocio.

Con mayores ventas, ella espera invertir las ganancias obtenidas para pagar los gastos estudiantiles y crianza de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lourdes L. is a single mother of two children and lives in the Oriental neighborhood in Danli, El Paraiso. Doña Lourdes has a business of selling food and sweets such as enchiladas, chilaquiles, baleadas, tortillas with cheese, catrachitas, yucca with pork cracklings, tacos, bottled beverages and natural water. Doña Lourdes has a year in this business and it should be noted that during this time she has efficiently managed it. The place where her business is located is good for this type of activity since it is the only stand at the establishment where the offices of the Department of Natural Resources of the city of Danli are located, also a place where the offices of SAG, Senasa, Pralebah, Proheco and the District Office of Education are housed. The majority of her customers are the employees of these institutions, and many of the employees buy food on credit and pay her when they get their paychecks. She also has customers from rural areas or people visiting these offices. which have a fair amount of traffic by people that live near the city center. Doña Lourdes will use the loan to buy necessary supplies for the making of the various dishes that she sells at her business. With increased sales. she hopes to invest her income in the payment of educational expenses and support of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages, water, tortillas, beans, cheese, oil, beef, lard, salt, condiments, butter, corn flour, yucca, pork cracklings and salsa.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 40 years old and is married to an accountant. She is blessed with four children: Andrew 19, Clarence 15, Charles 10 and Maxwell 2.

Rachel has been operating a retail shop for seven months. In her business, she has employed one person.

Rachel is a member of Stima group in Faulu Kenya whose members guarantee each other’s loans. She has previously managed to take out a loan of 20,000 KES to add to her stock.

Rachel has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to add to her stock of sugar, wheat flour, soda and maize flour. She hopes to open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of sugar, wheat flour, soda and maize flour

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Esther has a business of a beauty salon, which she has had for less than one year. To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more braids and oil for the hair. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Esther hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food for the family and take care of herself. In the future, Esther hopes to own a house and live a good life. Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy braids and oil for the hair

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en: Shiela J. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 28 years old and is single with two infant children. Shiela owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Shiela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Shiela is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Con Visión (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Mujeres con Visón, esta formado por un grupo de 11 señoras que trabajan en diferentes actividades para mejorar su situación económica y así sacar  adelante a sus familias. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es  conocida por su belleza arquitectónica, sus bellos paramos, su cultura, su gastronomía y  por su gente que es calida y cordial

La Señora Carmen Margarita Y. vive en la ciudad de Cuenca por el sector de Quinta Chica, este es el segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, ha llegado a tener una muy buena amistad con todas las socias que la conforman. Nuestra socia es muy joven tiene 25 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 8, 7, 5 y 3 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos  estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo trabaja en una fabrica realizando estucos (Cielos rasos), no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Carmen se dedica hace 3 años a la venta de productos Yanbal, L´bel etc, sus  ventas las realiza los días Lunes, Martes y Viernes, no tiene una horario fijo, los demás días vende pero muy poco ya que también les dedica tiempo a sus hijos que aun se encuentran pequeños. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra más cosméticos de la marca Yanbal como perfumes, cremas etc.
 
Su meta es  llegar a realizar su casa propia.

La Señora Mayra Alexandra S. vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, este es su tercer crédito que realiza  en la fundación y fue invitada por su mamá, los créditos le han beneficiado mucho en su negocio. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Avon,  actividad que la realiza hace un año. También trabaja como mesera en un restaurante lleva 8 meses en este trabajo y labora desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m. 
Doña Mayra tiene  24 años, es casada y tiene una hija de 5 años de edad  que está  en un jardín de infantes de la ciudad. Su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos de la marca Avon.
 
Su meta es  llegar a construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres con Visón (Women with Vision) is made up of 11 women who do different kinds of work to improve their economic situation and thus move their families ahead. They live in different places in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its architectural beauty, its beautiful mountain landscape, its culture, its food and for the warmth and hospitality of its people. Mrs. Carmen Margarita Y. lives in the city of Cuenca by the Quinta Chica area. This is her second loan that she has taken with the communal bank. She has developed a good friendship with all the members of the bank. Our member is very young. She is 25, married, and has 4 children: 8, 7, 5 and 3. Her three oldest children are in a school in the city. Her husbands works in a factory making stucco ( ceilings). They don’t have their own home so that live in a rented one. Mrs Carmen has worked for the last 3 years selling Yanbal, L’bel products, etc. She sells on Mondays, Tuesday and Fridays. She doesn’t have a regular schedule. The others days she sells only a little since she also has to spend time with her children who are still young. She will use her loan to buy more Yanbal cosmetics such as perfumes, creams, etc. He goal is to have her own home. Mrs. Mayra Alexandra S. lives in the city of Cuenca. This is her third loan that she has taken with the foundation and she was invited by her mother. The loans have greatly benefited her in her business. She sells Avon cosmetics, work that she has done for the past year. She has also been a waitress in a restaurant for the last 8 months and she works from 7 am to 3 pm. Mrs. Mayra is 24, married and has a 5 year old daughter who is in the kindergarten of the city. Her husband is a security guard. They don’t have their own home so they live in a rented one. She will use the loan to buy Avon cosmetics. Her goal is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Yanbal and Avon cosmetics, perfumes, creams and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Sincerity Group

texts.en:
Kou S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Sincerity.  She is 28 years old single, and has one child who is 8 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficult. She cares for two siblings.

For 4 years, she has been selling dried fish in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 5,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 25,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cartons of fish. 

She describes herself as a very hard-working woman whose dream is to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Ndiomdy Ngor Ndiaye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité NDIOMDY NGOR N. est créé le 15 octobre 2010. Il est composé de 45 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Ces femmes se sont organisées par liens de parenté et de voisinage. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame FATOU GNILANE D. levant la main et mise en médaillon, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle a la responsabilité de ses deux neveux.

Elle fait du petit commerce de denrées alimentaires (oignons, tomates, riz etc.)

Et avec son nouveau crédit de 50.000 francs CFA elle va elle va mieux organiser son petit commerce afin de pouvoir l'étendre et accroitre ses bénéfices.

Les profits générés par son activité lui permettra de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The Ndiomdy Ngor N. solidarity group was created on 15th October 2010. It is made up of 45 women who all come from the same village, and who know each other through relatives and neighbors. Their principal activity is small business.  

Mrs. Fatou Gnilane D., who is raising her hand and is also in the inset picture, is in charge of the group. She is 54 years old, married and mother to two children. She also has responsibility for her two nephews.

She has a small food products business (onions, tomatoes, rice, etc.). With her new loan of 50,000CFA she will be able to organise her small business better in order to increase her profits. The profits generated by her business will allow her to help her husband to take care of the family.

loans.use: Purchase food products

loans.name: Lhagva

texts.en:
Lhagva C. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Hovd province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His 4-year-old son attends a local kindergarten while his infant son stays at home. 

Lhagva and his wife work together in their retail clothing business. They began this business in 2008 and have since built up a stable and successful operation. Within the short period of operation, Lhagva has managed to increase his working capital and his earnings have enabled him to buy a small plot of land for his family. 

For the future, he plans to buy a new truck with his business profits and start operating a transportation business to supplement his earnings. Lhagva is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more winter clothing items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more winter clothing items for resale

loans.name: America

texts.es:
America de 30 años, tiene un puesto de venta de frutas. Vive en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes llamada suburbio de Guayaquil.  

Comenzó a trabajar en el mercado llamado “batallón del suburbio” porque su ex esposo la abandono cuando ella estaba embarazada y tuvo que encontrar una actividad económica para poder mantener a su bebe. Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido tener su propio puesto de frutas con ayuda de su actual pareja con la que tiene dos hijos. En la actualidad está embarazada pero aun sigue trabajando desde las 05h00am hasta las 14h30 de lunes a viernes para darle una mejor vida a sus hijos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar  frutas como tomatillos, papaya, uvas, frutillas para su negocio de frutas. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio con mas frutas y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con existo.
texts.en:
America, age 30, has a stand where she sells fruit. She lives in an urban area called Suburbio de Guayaquil where most of the residents work as merchants.

America began working at the market called “Batallón del Suburbio” because her ex-husband abandoned her when she was pregnant and needed to be able to support her baby. With some effort over time, she established her own fruit stand with the help of her current partner with whom she has two children. America is currently pregnant, but she continues working Monday to Friday from 5am to 2:30pm so that she can give her children a better life.

With this loan America will buy fruits such as tomatillos, papayas, grapes, and strawberries for her business. In the future, she wants to increase her business with more fruits and see her children finish their existing studies.

loans.use: Purchase fruits

loans.name: Lourdes Del Rocío

texts.es:
Lourdes tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con un pequeño establecimiento en su vivienda, allí ofrece en venta a sus clientes y vecinos diversos productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, sobretodo porque se encuentra ubicado en una zona céntrica. Adicionalmente comercializa productos de belleza por catálogo entre los clientes que llegan a su tienda. El negocio le hace sentir bastante activa y con las ganancias que obtiene se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

Lourdes desea ampliar sus negocio con la compra de más productos, ya que durante esta temporada la demanda aumenta. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 28 years old.  She is single and lives with her family in the Mochumi district, an agricultural area with plenty of business activity, which is found more than 1/2 hour from the city of Chiclayo.
She has a small store in her residence.  She sells diverse necessities and groceries to customers and neighbors.  Her business has prospered, mostly because it is located in a central zone. She also sells beauty products through a catalog to her customers.  She feels quite active with her business and has income sufficient to sustain and advance her family.
Lourdes wants to expand her business by purchasing more products.  This is the season when demand increases; therefore, she has requested a loan of $550 (1500 nuevos soles) from Edpyme Alternative (local lending institution).

loans.use: Purchase of additional inventory

loans.name: Jose Yamil

texts.en:
Jose is twenty-two years old and lives lives in the village of Portidor in the district of Las Lomas. It is a semi-tropical zone primarily populated by small farmers and ranchers. Many residents own small fruit plantations and raise cattle or other smaller animals. Jose is single and lives with his parents.

Jose raises fowl and sheep for sale in local markets. He has corrals behind the home of his parents in which he raises turkeys, ducks and chickens. In addition to raising animals, Jose drives a mototaxi, providing transport and cargo services to his neighbors. His father owns the mototaxi.

This will be Jose’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa. He plans to use the loan to purchase additional feed for his animals and make repairs to his corrals. He hopes these improvements will help him raise healthier animals in a shorter period of time in order to increase his income and create a more sustainable business. Jose is very hard working and has dreams of getting ahead. He appreciates the access to credit that Edpyme Alternativa is providing and the reduced interest rate that is a result of Kiva funding.

loans.use: to purchase feed and repair corrals

loans.name: Wilmo Gerardo

texts.es:
Wilmo Gerardo M. O. tiene 35 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la conviviente y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE, pertenece a la comunidad o recinto el Placer, a una distancia de 120 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.

Wilmo Gerardo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao. Las compras y ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes en la feria de los días Domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es dar los estudios a los hijos y que cumplan las metas.

Le gusta ver la televisión, escuchar las noticias en la radio.
texts.en:
Wilmo Gerardo M. O. is 35 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He has five children.

The members of the LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE (Hope Is Never Lost) community bank are based in the community of El Placer, 120 minutes from our Chillanes office.  Most of the members of this community bank work in agriculture. 

Wilmo Gerardo is a farmer who grows corn and cacao.  He makes his purchases and sales in Chillanes canton, at the Sunday market.

Wilmo Gerardo is requesting this loan to buy seeds, manure and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as plant diseases, illnesses and changes in the weather.  His dream is to provide his children with an education and to accomplish his goals.

Wilmo Gerardo likes watching television and listening to the news on the radio.

loans.use: To buy seeds, manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Leonardo Eulogio

texts.es:
Leonardo Eulogio D. M., tiene 21 años, vive en Unión libre con su esposa en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Los Ángeles, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, 

Leonardo Eulogio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, Compra sus productos en  Farma - Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un trabajo estable.

Le gusta hacer amigos y ser responsable.
texts.en:
Leonardo Eulogio D. M., age 21, lives with his common-law wife in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. He has 1 child.
The members of the V.R.C. Ciudadela Los Angeles are located in the Los Angeles district, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The 14 members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture sowing corn.
Leonardo Eulogio works in agriculture sowing corn. He purchases his products in Farma-Agro and sells in the same location.
He is requesting this loan for sowing corn and purchasing supplies and seeds. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to have a stable job.
He enjoys making friends and being responsible.

loans.use: the purchase of supplies and seeds

loans.name: Honronya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Honronya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana,  quartier Banankabougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habillements, de légumes et d’articles divers de boutique.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Honronya sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
FANTA T. compte acheter,  quelques moquettes à Gao et des pièces de tissus à Bamako presque mensuellement. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place à la maison et au marché, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women of the Honronya group, all married, are 35 years old on average with 5 children and live in traditional extended households in the Banankabougou area of the city of Fana in the Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region in the Republic of Mali).
They know each other through familial, neighbourhood, and social relations. They sell clothing, vegetables, and various store items.
The women of the Benkan group are on their first solidarity (group) loan.
Fanta T., one of the group members, intends to buy some moquette in Gao and bolts of fabric in Bamako almost every month. She makes her sales every day at home and at the market in Marka-Coungo, in cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of women and men.
She foresees realizing an average monthly profit of 15,000 FCFA, some of which will be used to repay the loan costs and to provide for various social events, with the remainder being reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African cloth)

loans.name: Esmeraldo

texts.en:
Esmeraldo S. is from the village of Turod. He is 51 years old. Esmeraldo is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Esmeraldo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Esmeraldo has been engaged in his business for over 31 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Esmeraldo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esmeraldo is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Esmeraldo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Fanny Del Socorro

texts.es:
Fanny es una mujer emprendedora, madre de dos hijos, con su propio negocio un cyber en donde ofrece varios servicios de internet, llamadas telefónicas, recargas electrónicas. Con más de seis años, el cual ha venido mejorando tecnología con equipos nuevos con financiamiento que Afodenic ha otorgado en seis ciclos. Lo que está contenta ya que ha logrado apoyar a su familia, equilibrar sus gastos y poder satisfacer sus gastos personales.
Con esta nueva solicitud es  para trasladar de servicios de claro a servicios Yota con un alto nivel avanzado, lo que dará un mejor servicio. En donde comprara varios equipos para esta instalación.
texts.en:
Fanny is an enterprising woman and the mother of two children. She owns her own internet cafe from where she offers a variety of internet services, public telephones, and prepaid cards. She has more than six years in the business and she has improved the technology with new systems with the help of loans accessed through Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) over the past six loan cycles. She is very happy to have been able to support her family and to be able to balance her expenses and still be able to cover her personal expenses.

This new loan will be used to move from Claro services to Yota services that operate at a much higher level, thereby improving service. She will purchase various systems to install.

loans.use: To purchase new systems for her internet cafe.

loans.name: Oyunsuren

texts.en: Oyunsuren, 37, is married and lives with her husband and five children in Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia,. They live in their own house on a small plot of land that they own. Her husband works as a salesperson for a company where he gets paid 500,000 monthly. Her three older children attend a local secondary school while the younger two go to kindergarten. Oyunsuren holds a degree as an engineer and economist. She worked for a company from 2005 to 2009 and began her own business in 2010. She rents a stall at a trading center where she sells curtains and curtain accessories. She pays 300,000 MNT for the monthly rent of the stall. Her current total working capital is 2,000,000 MNT and daily net income is 100,000 MNT. She is a hardworking and polite person who says, "I  am trying to expand my business and enlarge my stall". She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy more curtains for her business.

loans.use: To buy more curtains

loans.name: Don Bosco Group

texts.es:
Paulina es una madre soltera quien tuvo la gran responsabilidad como madre de criar a cinco hijos de los cuales uno es dependiente de ella. Paulina empezó a vender desde muy joven a fin de apoyar en un inicio a su pareja, luego con el tiempo esta persona buscó otro hogar, pero no siendo impedimento para ella pues el vender gaseosas, queques, chupetes, ropa le ayudó mucho para mantener a su familia con los gastos. Posteriormente mejoró su capital que invirtió luego en mercadería de frutas en su pequeño triciclo que le regalaron y lo ofrecía en la zona donde vive; aunque muchas veces tuvo que viajar conseguir sus ventas; lamentablemente enfermó poco después tuvo que dejarlo este negocio y comenzar de nuevo en otro esta vez compró pequeñita mercadería de gaseosas, detergentes, leche y arroz en un pequeño espacio donde vive. Muy esforzada y empeñosa llegó a surtir su kiosquito ubicado a una esquina de su casa; no es así que también trabaja como personal de limpieza en casas además de lavado de ropa. Aunque el dar educación escolar a sus cinco hijos ha sido una de sus metas y espera culminar con su último hijo termine el colegio. Invertirá este préstamo en abarrotes como azúcar, leche, fideos, arroz y gaseosas pues es lo que necesita.
Tener una casa propia en su más grande sueño e instalar una tiendita surtida, pues ella es guardiana de una vivienda hace años. Se siente feliz por el apoyo que brinda los prestamistas Kiva a personas pequeñas como ella pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Paulina es la persona que viste de polo amarillo con un bolso rojo.
texts.en:
Paulina is a single mother who had the great responsibility as a mother of raising five children, one of which is dependent on her. Paulina began to sell things when she was very young, originally in order to support her partner. Later, over time, this person looked for another place to live, but this was not an obstacle for her, because selling soda, cakes, pacifiers, and clothing very much helped her support her family with their expenses. Later she improved her capital, which she then invested in a supply of fruit on her little tricycle that was given to her, and she offered it in the area where she lives, although many times she had to travel to make her sales. Sadly, she got sick a little later and had to give up this business and start over with a different one. This time she bought a small supply of soda, detergents, milk, and rice in a small space where she lives. Very diligent and hardworking, she put up her kiosk in a corner of her house. She also works as a housekeeper in addition to washing clothes. Providing school education to her five children has been one of her goals and she hopes to reach it when her last child finishes high school. She will invest this loan in groceries such as sugar, milk, noodles, rice, and soda because that is what she needs.
Having her own house is her greatest dream as well as setting up a small, well-stocked store, given that she has been the guardian of a house for years. She is happy for the support provided by the Kiva loans to small people such as herself who really want to get ahead. Paulina is the person wearing a yellow shirt with a red purse.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, noodles, rice, and soda

loans.name: Tagaymurod
