texts.ru: Курбонов Тагаймурод проживает в районе Фархор. Возраст, 52 года. Женат. Имеет 6 детей. Дети живут отдельно. Сам он имеет средне - техническое образование, инженер. По специальности проработал 30 лет. Сейчас он занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где выращивает овощи. В этом ему помогает жена. Он в основном выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для покупки семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Tagaymurod K. lives in Farkhor. He is 52 years old, married, and has six children. His children do not live with him. He has a vocational education as an engineer. He worked in his field for thirty years. Now he works in agriculture.  He rents the plot of land where he grows vegetables. His wife helps him. He primarily grows vegetables for sale. He has been doing this work for six years.  He is taking out a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Merian

texts.en:
Merian G. is from the village of Songco, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 21 years old. Merian is married and has 1 child. To make a living, Merian owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, junk foods, beverages, shampoo, soap, sugars & instant noodles in the local community. Merian has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Merian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Merian is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & junk foods. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Merian from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & junk foods.

loans.name: Rebie

texts.en:
Rebie S. is from the village of Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Rebie is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Rebie owns and operates a tricycle transport service. (A tricycle is a motorcycle with a passenger cab.) Rebie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Rebie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rebie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. 

Rebie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the third loan taken out by Rebie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: Sath

texts.en: Mr. Sath, 41 years old, is a humble villager living in the Baray district of Kompong Tom. He is married and blessed with five children. Four of the children are single and still study and the other one is married and lives in his own house.  To earn a living, he provides a motorbike taxi services. Mr. Sath’s wife sells many kinds of Khmer cakes in the mobile place. Recently, his existing motorbike has broken down often during use. Because of that, Mr. Sath has decided to seek a loan of $600 from Kiva, which he will use to replace the broken motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike (Tuk Tuk).

loans.name: Lusinda

texts.es:
Lusinda es una madre de familia de 49  años de edad, ella vive con sus  2 hijos menores es edad escolar. Lusinda vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en la  zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, en un caserío llamado Cruz del Medano ubicado a 15 minutos  de la ciudad de Mórrope, en donde solo cuenta con el servicio de agua solamente, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias.

Lusinda se dedica a la  comercialización  de animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ella suele criar ganado porcino, ovino y pavos y patos y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive, esta actividad la realiza desde su domicilio.  Lusinda aprendió esta actividad de sus padres y desde hace 20 años ella se dedica a dicha labor, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.

Lusinda está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2200 nuevos soles para poder  invertir en la compra de aves menores para su engorde, con su respectivo alimento balanceado dichos animales.  

Lusinda es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Lusinda is a 49-year-old mother living with her two minor, school age children.  Lusinda lives in her own house located in the rural part of Mórrope District in a hamlet called Cruz del Medano about 15 minutes from the city of Mórrope.  The house only has water and the community is small; it only has about 200 families.

Lusinda is a small farm animal merchant.  She raises them in corrals located in her back yard.  She tends to raise pigs, sheep, turkeys and ducks and when they reach a good stage of development she sells them to merchants that always frequent the area where she lives.  She runs her business from home.  Lusinda learned this activity from her parents and has been in this line of work for 20 years now, that is to say, she knows the occupation to perfection.

Lusinda is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2200 new sol loan to buy barnyard fowl to raise and to buy their respective balanced feed.

Lusinda is quite a hard working woman who strives daily to get ahead and have a better quality of life.  People who know her consider her to be kind and always willing to help others.

loans.use: to buy fowl.

loans.name: 2 Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoè works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Hoè is 64 years old and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 7.1.2 Phú Sơn  solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

This is Hoè first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoè has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is her lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoè hopes for her children to find a good job and for her business to do well.

loans.use: To purchase breeding animals and cattle-feed.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther es natural de Chupaca, en la actualidad vive con sus hijos en su propia casa. Trabaja duramente año tras año en las tareas del campo, esta tradición de trabajo la lleva desde su niñez porque sus padres la instruyeron con la mentalidad de esforzarse para conseguir las metas que se le presenten en su vida, por lo que no fue obstáculo para ella desarrollar esta actividad a pesar de no contar con el apoyo de familiares para contratar peones y poder realizar los trabajos pesados. Los productos que cultiva son el maíz, que con ayuda de sus hijos los seca en el patio de su casa y desgrana para venderlo por kilos a un mejor precio y así obtener mayores ganancias. Uno de sus metas es mejorar su producción y con el tiempo tener un establo ganadero donde tenga vacas lecheras. Pero, mientras esta en camino a concretar este proyecto, seguirá esforzándose para conseguir las ganancias necesarias. Son varias oportunidades que ha trabajado con MFP en créditos de manera grupal de las cuales se retiro por un tiempo pero en la actualidad retoma el trabajo grupal de manera solidaria porque considera que es positivo trabajar con personas que son de su confianza. Con el dinero comprará sacos de abono para seguir sembrando.
texts.en:
Esther is from Chupaca.  She currently lives with her children in her own home.  She works hard, year after year, farming.  She has had this work ethic since she was a child because her parents instilled in her the mentality to work hard in order reach the goals that present themselves in life.  For this reason, she managed to carry out her work in spite of the fact that she didn't have the support of family members to hire farm workers to help carry out the heavy labor.  

Esther grows corn which, with the help of her children, she dries in a patio area outside her home and removes the kernels.  She then sells these by the kilo for a better price and makes more profits.  One of her goals is to improve her production and, over time, own a stable where she will keep dairy cows.  Whilst she is working on establishing that project, she continues working hard to make the profits she needs.

Esther has worked with MFP on several occasions, taking group loans.  She stopped doing that for a time but is currently going back to working as part of a community bank because she believes it to be a positive experience working with people she trusts.  She will use this money to buy sacks of manure so that she can continue growing her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure

loans.name: 5 De Mayo Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama 5 de mayo, se localiza en la comunidad de Ocuituco, Mexico, esta conformado por la señora Isabel va a comprar con su prestamo botes de durazno, la señora Maria del Carmen va a comprar arroz, queso, aceite, papel, bolsas para preparar la comida para los antojitos, la señora Eufrocina va a comprar huevo, azucar,jabon, aceite para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, la señora Yecenia va a comprar alimento para engordar cerdos, la señora Victorina va a comprar toneles,garrafas y botes. La señora Victorina tiene 22 años de edad, ella vive en union libre con su esposo ellos tiene 2 hijos Milton de 6 años de edad y Tony de 1 año de edad, ella solicito su prestamo para comprar material de plastico botes, garrafas y tambos para vender, ella inicio su negocio hace 7 años es herencia de sus suegros, ellos le enseñaron a trabajar en este negocio, su esposo salen a los pueblos vecinos a vender sus productos con los campesinos, su negocio es importante porque de ahi sale para la alimentacion de sus hijos y para vestirlos, ella esta orgullosa por la preferencia de los clientes que son los campesinos y de viajar y conocer otros pueblos. Ocuituco es un pueblo bonito, tranquilo de clima templado, hay mucha vegetacion, arboles frutales se da el aguacate, celebran el 25 de julio a Santiago Apostol hay misas, juegos pirotecnicos. Ella tiene la esperanza de tener su casa propia, hacer mas grande su negocio para poder darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundacion Realidad "les damos las gracias por su apoyo y la confianza que nos dan y que sigan ayudando a mas personas".
texts.en:
This group is called “5 de Mayo” and is located in the community of Ocuituco, México.  Its members are Isabel who will use the loan to buy cans of peaches, María del Carmen who will buy rice, cheese, oil, paper and bags to prepare fast food snacks, Eufrocina who will buy eggs, sugar, soap and oil to stock her grocery store, Yecenia who will buy feed to fatten up pigs and Victorina who will buy drums, jugs and cans.

Victorina is 22 years old and lives in common law relationship with her husband.  They have two children: Milton, 6, and Tony, 1. She asked for her loan to buy plastic items: drums, cans and jugs to sell.  She started the business 7 years ago; it was an inheritance from her in-laws.  They taught her the business.  Her husband goes out to adjacent towns to sell the items to the people in the countryside.  Her business is important because that’s where she gets what she needs to feed and clothe her children.  She is proud that her customers, who are the country folk, prefer her and she enjoys going out to get to know other towns.

Ocuituco is a pretty town.  It has a mild climate, much vegetation and fruit trees. Avocadoes are abundant.  The 25th of July is celebrated as St. James the Apostle Feast Day.  Masses are celebrated and there are fireworks displays.

She hopes to have her own house and to enlarge the business to be able to provide her children with better quality of life.  

The group members would like to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad: “We thank you for your support and for the trust you’ve place in us and keep helping other people.”

loans.use: to buy plastic cans, jugs and drums.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 28 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala Central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Sarah has a small retail shop selling goods such as sugar, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  

In the future, Sarah hopes to expand her business.    Sarah is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities.

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Anabella has a shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Anabella is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Anabella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Gustavo de 58 años es un hombre casado con 5 hijos en las edades de 22 a 38 años; vive al sur de la ciudad y allí tiene su negocio donde vende vísceras y carne de res por libras, el cual inició hace más de 30 años por todas las calles de la ciudad montado en un  burro. Su experiencia de negocio data desde cuando se dedicaba a remontar cazado en un espacio en su vivienda. En la actualidad distribuye las vísceras y carne de res en todo el barrio y en sus alrededores, compra en el mercado público a las 4.00 a m. y a las 6 de la mañana empieza su venta de hígado, riñón, ubre, patas y mondongo, para que las familias objeto que le compran preparen sus alimentos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues  planea comprar en mayor volumen vísceras y un nuevo medio de transporte, para seguir distribuyendo su carne entre sus clientes. Su sueño más adelante es tener un punto comercial en su propia casa, con un buen sistema  congelamiento que le permita conservar sus carnes.  Mientras esto ocurre maneja una buena rentabilidad y se esmera día a día por aumentar sus clientes y obtener nuevas ganancias.
texts.en:
Gustavo, 58, is married and has five children, ages 22 to 38.  He lives on the south side of the city where he has a business selling beef and entrails by the pound.  He began his business over 30 years ago when he was a street vendor using a donkey for transportation.  His business expertise dates back from when he used to have a shoe repair shop in his home.  Now he distributes beef and entrails throughout the neighborhood and surrounding areas.  He buys at the public market at 4:00 a.m. and then at 6:00 a.m. begins selling liver, kidneys, udder, feet and tripe so the consumers have time to prepare their meals.  

He is applying for a credikiva which is his first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  He will use the loan to buy greater amounts of entrails and a new mode of transportation in order to continue distributing meat among his customers.  His dream is to set up a shop in his own home, with a good freezer system to preserve the meat.  Meanwhile he is making a decent profit and works hard every day to increase customers and earnings.

loans.use: To buy greater volumes of entrails and a new means of transportation.

loans.name: Emprendedoras 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Martha is the coordinator of her group 'Emprendedoras' (entrepreneurs) 1, 2 & 3. The group is located in the city of El Seybo, in a rural community outsiD. of the main city. The group numbers 15 small businesspeople, dedicated to many different business activities in their community and the surrounding area.

Martha makes her home in a simple house with her husband and their two children. She plans to continue working most of the time. She became an Esperanza associate because she needed to start a business. She organized with some neighbors to form a group in her community to obtain loans to do business and make changes in their lives. She has had her business for more than five years, starting after her first Esperanza loan.

Martha is excited to be taking out her 8th loan with Esperanza, having successfully repaid her previous loans and expanded her business. She runs a small grocery store and plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying goods including rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, and canned food. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to save money.

The group pictures are separated to show as many faces as possible.

loans.use: to buy goods including rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, and canned food.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en: Mario is a 47-year-old married man with three children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been buying and selling milk for twelve years. With the income earned, he bought a milk cooler so as to preserve the milk. His hardship is the dry season which leads to low production. His vision is to buy Friesian cows (a breed of cattle known today as the world's highest production dairy animal) so as to increase production and educate his children. Mario needs the loan to buy cows for milk production.

loans.use: to buy cows for milk production.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama fries fish for sale in Abura. She has received a high-school education. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in taking care of the home.

Ama has been selling fried fish for 2 years. She will use her loan to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale. She hopes to save the profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao, age 37, is married and earns a living to support her family by sewing clothes. Her husband is involved in the business of repairing old sewing machines. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Thao has been sewing clothes for eight years. Thao would now like to take out a loan to expand her business. With the loan, she intends to buy some sewing machines that will enable her to make better quality clothes for her customers. She hopes that this will generate more income and that she can save money for her children to go to school.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines to make better quality clothes for her customers.

loans.name: Regana

texts.en:
Regana is 25 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married and has two children 7 and 9 years old. They are in school and live at home.

For the past two years she has been selling rice and oil in the local market. She make a lot of profit and has a lot of customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and oil for her business. Her plan is to become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and oil for her business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 46 years old and lives in Macalibre, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one adult-aged child. 

Helen has a shop that sells candles. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase more boxes of candles to sell.

Helen has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Helen hopes to succeed in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more boxes of candles to sell

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 40 years old. She lives in the village Sartichala with her family: her husband George, a 17-year-old daughter, and a 16-year-old son. Both children go to school. 

Nino works in a local school as a teacher. Along with her main job, she is actively involved in the family's dairy farm. In particular, they have two milk cows. Nino produces cheese and sells monthly on average 60 kg of the product in Tbilisi (capital city of the country).

Nino requested credit for purchasing high-quality natural food for her cows for the winter months. It will increase yield of milk and allow the family to produce and sell more dairy products. The family will use the increased income for their well-being.

loans.use: To purchase feed for cows for winter months.

loans.name: Liana

texts.ru:
Лиана родилась в 1984 году в городе Ашхабаде, Туркменской Республики. В возрасте 14 лет она с семьей переехала в  Армению и поселилась в городе Капане. После окончания средней школы она вышла замуж и переехала к мужу в деревню Гехи (Geghi). У Лианы двое сыновей: старший учится в средней школе, а младший посещает детский сад. В данный момент Лиана работает в сельской общине. 
Лиана и ее муж на протяжении 10 лет занимаются сельскохозяйственным бизнесом. Они выращивают овощи и фрукты, а также разводят крупный рогатый скот, овец и свиней. 
Выращенные овощи и фрукты они продают на рынках Сьюникской области, а  мясо и молоко у них покупают постоянные скупщики прямо из дома. Благодаря занятию сельским хозяйством Лиана и ее муж содержат семью.
Лиане нужен кредит на сумму 1.000.000 армянских драм, для покупки сена, комбинированного корма и нескольких свиней.
texts.en:
Liana was born in 1984 in Ashgabat, the Turkmen Republic. At age 14 she and her family moved to Armenia and settled in the town of Kapan. After graduating from high school she married and moved with her husband to the village of Geghi. Liana has two sons. The elder son goes to high school and the younger one goes to kindergarten. At the moment Liana works on a communal farm.. 

For ten years, Liana and her husband have been doing farm work. They grow vegetables and fruit, as well as breeding cattle, sheep and pigs. The fruit and vegetables they produce are sold in markets in the Syunikskoy area, and they sell meat and milk out of their home to regular customers. Thanks to the farm, Liana and her husband are able to provide for the family. Liana needs a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy hay, feed, and a few pigs.

loans.use: To buy fodder for her farm animals and also to buy some pigs

loans.name: Vrezh

texts.en:
Vrezh lives in Pambak village, Lori region. He is 43 years old. Vrezh is married. He has two children who are students in Vanadzor teachers' training institute. Vrezh’s wife is jobless. 

Vrezh has been engaged in cattle breeding for a long time. Vrezh gets part of the fodder for his farm animals from his own plot of land. Any extra fodder is purchased from fellow villagers. Vrezh and his wife produce cheese, butter and meat for sale. Thes products support their family and pay for their children’s education.
 
Vrezh needs a 500.000 AMD loan to buy fodder for winter.

loans.use: to buy extra fodder for winter.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 25-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents. He has been working as a human resource manager in one of the local malls since 2009. At the same time, he hopes to carry on his education in order to reach higher positions. 

For that reason, he has big and serious responsibilities to care for. Today, he wants to borrow $1,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his own educational fees until graduation. He will be more than happy to graduate and achieve his master’s degree.  

In the future, he plans to take new Kiva loans and maybe open his own business.

loans.use: to pay his own educational fees until graduation.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Contributing to her family’s vending business, Eunice found herself happiest. Before owning her business, Jems Italian Ice, Eunice worked as a chemist in a research institution. She also added, now that she is married, she could not go home after a hectic day of work and expect to have some alone time. Then one day a friend, who was selling Italian Ice in Atlanta, suggested Eunice do the same. After she found it was profitable, she said she “went in it full force.”

The small business, composed of family and friends, began when she lost her passion and felt the need to exit the corporate world. Eunice’s family worked festivals for five years now as she helped them annually. As she recalls, working festivals gave them an opportunity to have conversations with 1000s of people. What attracted her the most to festivals were mainly the “loving people and atmosphere.” Eunice was raised doing community work and decided to do this and serve people in the community while having fun selling Italian Ice.

Eunice will use the loan money to purchase a large trailer for storage and transportation to save money on renting trailers. As a traveling vendor, Eunice noted that in order to participate in 2012 festivals, which normally begin in March, she needs to register in December. From here, she needs to begin booking hotels and planning trips. 

She told of how Italian ice differs from traditional ice cream. Italian ice has “fresher ingredients and is made with finer ice so it almost melts in mouth,” she said. She juggles eight flavors that change according to what customers like.

It would have taken a year and a half to collect the amount of money needed. The loan from ACCION Texas allowed her to skip that process and dive into applying for festivals and ordering supplies. She can now attend large festivals instead of many smaller ones. For more information on Eunice, Jems Italian Ice and nutritional information, visit the website: www.jemsitalianice.com.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for storage and transportation.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 29 años, se describe como una persona luchadora, responsable, trabajadora que siempre busca el bienestar de sus hijos. María vive con sus dos hijos en Machachi en la provincia de Pichincha.

María trabaja sola en la crianza de animales como pollos, cuyes. Trabaja en este negocio ya que es el único ingreso para su familia, realiza su segundo crédito para poder construir galpones para sus animales ya que se le estaban perdiendo y eso ocacionaba pérdidas y bajos ingresos. Con esta inversión podrá tener seguros a sus animales y criarlos de mejor manera. Los buenos ingresos económicos a María ayudan a mantener a sus hijos y darles una buena educación.

María tiene la visión de comprar una vaca para entrar al negocio de la leche para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 29 year-old woman who describes herself as tenacious, responsible and hardworking.  She is always seeking to provide for the well-being of her children.  Maria lives with her 2 children in Machachi in Pichincha province.

Maria works alone raising animals such as chickens and guinea pigs.  She works in this business because it is the only source of income for her family.  She is taking her 2nd loan to build sheds for her animals, since she has been losing some of them, and this has caused economic losses for her.  With this investment she will be able to have better security for her animals and raise them in a better way.  Maria's good income helps her to support her children and give them a good education.

Maria envisions buying a cow to enter the milk business so that she could improve the quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to build sheds for her chickens, because she doesn't have a secure place for them to prevent them from being stolen

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 60 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is a business man. She has been running a retail shop for the past three years with a monthly income of 10,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.

Jacinta is requesting her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to buy sugar and rice for her shop. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her dream is to open a wholesale shop, which will help improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and rice for her shop.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Basma prefers not to have her photograph on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her daughter.  Basma is a 49-year-old married woman who has four family members from Nao'or, Jordan.  She is requesting a loan of 1,500 JOD to buy woman and children clothes to resell in the same neighborhood to her friends and neighbors she wants to increase her products.  In the future she hopes to expand her project by opening a shop to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
El Sr. G. cuenta con una peluquería improvisada en su casa, su deseo es poder acondicionarla en forma adecuada tal y como la tienen sus hermanos en el centro de la ciudad.

“Hace ya mas de una década que en conjunto con mis hermanos echamos a andar una peluquería en el centro de la ciudad, hoy en día decidí independizarme y acople un cuarto de mi casa, toda mi vida me he dedicado a esto, hoy quiero tener mi propio negocio, solicito $1,500.00 dlls para comprar equipo y herramienta.”

loans.use: comprar equipo y herramienta.”

loans.name: Gracious

texts.en: Gracious is a widowed mother of 3 children. Her husband died early last year. This has made it difficult for her to pay school fees for the children. With the assistance of some friends, she managed to secure a charcoal sales business in front of their rented premises. Even though sales are good, household expenses take a great chunk of the profits with almost nothing to reinvest. She is therefore very keen to secure the KIVA loan to augment her dwindling capital.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.en:
Maria is a married mother of three (ages 8, 12 and 17). Her husband works for a local business, but his wages are low. To help with household expenses and the children's education, Maria decided three year ago to start her own business selling natural health products, and she also sells steamed tacos. Love for her family and commitment to her husband motivates her to work hard day to day.

Currently, Maria needs a loan of $275 to purchase more health products to fulfill her clients' orders and to offer them a better service for repeat business. She plans to repay the loan within four to eight months. You can play an important role in Maria's success, and she is grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maria de Jesús es casada, tiene tres hijos de 8, 12 y 17 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa pero el asalario que recibe es muy bajo, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar y con la escuela de sus hijos, Maria decidió, hace tres años, iniciar su propio negocio vendiendo productos naturales y combinó esta actividad con la venta de tacos a vapor. El amor hacia su familia y el fiel compromiso con su esposo es lo que la motiva a trabajar arduamente día con día.

En estos momentos, Maria necesita de un crédito por $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir los pedidos que tiene de productos naturistas, y poder ofrecer un buen servicio para conservar la preferencia de sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en los logros de Maria, no lo pienses más y decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: Purchase natural health products

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Mr Teodoro is 51 years old and widowed. He has two daughters, one is a teacher and the other a nurse. Both his daughters are single and live in their own house adjoined to their father's. They contribute to the family's income and help their father. He has always been their greatest supporter, and his efforts have allowed them to complete their studies.

For more than 20 years Mr Teodora has worked at a body shop, painting and repairing vehicles. He owns his own body shop, which he inherited from his father and is located 12 kilometers from the city of Paraguari, Escobar. He travels every day from his shop, where his great work has attracted many clients. Some weeks ago his electric solder stopped working. He needs to acquire a new one so that he can resume his work. A new electric soldering machine costs 200 dollars, and for this reason he asks for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Teodoro tiene 51 años, es viudo, tienen dos hijas una es docente y la otra es enfermera, ambas aún solteras, viven en una casa propia junto con su padre; ellas aportan con los ingresos de la familia y ayudan a su padre, pues el siempre fue el mayor apoyo de ellas y gracias al trabajo de su padre pudieron culminar sus estudios

El Sr. Teodoro se dedica hace ya más de 20 años a la pintura y chapería de vehículos, tiene un taller propio que heredo de su padre y que queda a 12 Km de la ciudad de Paraguarí, en una ciudad llamada Escobar. Viaja todos los días hasta su taller, donde gracias a su buen trabajo posee muchos clientes; hace unas semanas su soldador eléctrico se descompuso y no tiene solución, por ello necesita adquirir uno nuevo, que le permita reanudar sus trabajos que quedaron pendientes a causa de esto; un soldador nuevo cuesta $ 200, por ello el solicita un crédito que se compromete a devolverlo mensualmente.

loans.use: To purchase an electric soldering machine

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: I have been stitching clothes on order from the women of the neighborhood for a long time and my husband sells fruit from a fruit cart. We both work extremely hard just to meet our expenses and send our children to school. My husband now wants to introduce a larger variety of fruits to his cart so that he may get more business. Hopefully, this will increase our income and let us better our financially downtrodden state. We need a loan of $200.

loans.use: Wants to expand her husband's fruit cart business

loans.name: Matilde Bassane

texts.pt:
Matilde is unmarried but she lives with the father of her 4 children. She lives in Chibuto in the district of the same name. She began the loan program in 2005 as part of a group. Now she is applying for an individual loan. Her business is running smoothly. All of her children are in school. She helps her husband with household expenses. She is a seamstress. She has practiced this profession since she was young. She hopes to invest in her business with this loan and attract more clients.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Matilde e solteira mas vive com umhomem com quem tem 4 filhos. Ela vive em Chibuto, sede do distrito do mesmo nome.Ela entrou para o Programa de credito em 2005 como membro de um grupo. Agora ela quer tomar o emprestimo individualmente. O negocio esta a correr-lhe bem. Todos os filhos de Matilde estao a estudar. Ela consegue ajudar o marido nas despesas da casa. Ela e modista. Desde jovem que ela exerce esta profissao.Assim com o emprestim ela quer investir no seu negocio para poder angariar mais clientes.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for sales.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Mrs. Ruth A. is 30 yrs old, married with 2 children. She lives in Ehakpen Street in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has a shop and sells clothes in the village market and has been in this business for 7 years. She needs a loan of $525 to buy more clothes to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more gently used clothes to sell

loans.name: Robinah's Group

texts.en: Robinah is 31 years old and works as a supermarket attendant. She intends to use the profits to pay tution fees for her studies and purchase a deep freezer.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer

loans.name: Rosenda Federica

texts.es:
My 2 siblings and I live in this house. We would like to enlarge it a bit at the front because we only have two rooms and there's not enough space for the 3 of us. We need privacy and more room. I'm asking for US$1,000 to enlarge my house."

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

“En mi casa vivimos mis 2 hermanos y yo, así es que nos gustaría ampliar nuestra casa un poco hacia adelante ya que tenemos solo 2 cuartos y el espacio es muy reducido para los 3, necesitamos privacidad y sobre todo estar más cómodos”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para ampliar mi vivienda

loans.use: Home improvement.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate A. is married to a police man and has 5 children, 3 of whom she is currently taking care of.  Kate is a fishmonger who buys fish from local fishermen and sells them to customers.  She is requesting a loan of $525 to buy more fish as well as equipment to cook and smoke the fish.

Kate is also a member of a lending group called “Nkor Ma Ahoto Traders”, which consists of 11 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy more fish as well as equipment to cook and smoke the fish.

loans.name: María Ramona

texts.en:
María Ramona is 42 years old, and she and her husband have a unique 12-year-old daughter. Her husband works as a security agent in a commercial bank.

To supplement the family’s income, María Ramona sells a collection of shoes, slippers, and also beauty products to women of the Hato Nuevo community of San Cristobal, her hometown. Ramona operates the business predominantly from her house, but sometimes she visits some friends and other women in the neighborhood to offer and sell her products.

With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy beauty products and shoes so as to continue satisfying her customers’ needs.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of perfumes, beauty products and other goods to resell in her community.

loans.name: Suyen Nataly

texts.es:
Suyen Vasquez is a single mother with two young children who is obligated to maintain and provide all of the daily needs for her kids' develpomkent. She is originally from the community of Villanueva in the city of Chinandega. Presently her biggest worry is having to fix her home, she hasn't had a chance to finish it due to her low daily income.

For that reason, today she is asking Ceprodel for a loan to be able to provide her children a safe, comfortable place to live. The loan will cover all the materials needed to continue fixing her home in Villanueva.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Suyen Vasquez es una madre soltera y con dos hijos infantes que tiene el deber de mantener y proporcionarles las condiciones de vida necesarias para su desarrollo. Ella es originaria del municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega. Actualmente la problemática que ella atraviesa es la urgencia de continuar con la reparación de su casa debido a que al haber iniciado esta labor, no la terminó por el hecho de que el recurso económico no lo tenía.

Por este motivo, hoy en día acude a Ceprodel con el convencimiento de que sus hijos necesitan un techo digno y para ello ha solicitado un crédito que le permita adquirir los materiales de construcción para continuar con su ardua labor de reconstrucción de su casa de habitación en Villanueva.

loans.use: Buy construction materials.

loans.name: Thuok Saom Group

texts.en: Five people in Andong Chek Village have formed a group and Mrs. Thuok S. is their group leader. She sells baskets and her husband is a basket maker. They have two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is too young to work or study. In order to improve the family budget, Mrs. Thuok S. decided to ask for a loan both to buy bamboo to make more baskets and to buy ready-made ones to re-sell. Previously, Mrs. Thuok S. had obtained a loan to buy baskets to re-sell.

loans.use: To buy bamboo to make more baskets and to buy ready-made ones to re-sell.

loans.name: Azima

texts.en:
Azima is 49 years old, married and living in Kotorsko, near the town of Doboj. She has two children, both of whom are grown and married. Her husband works in construction, and is working in Slovenia for the summer. In the off season, he runs a car wash out of the family garage. Azima works on their farm to help support them, raising chicks and growing vegetables. This 1,000KM loan is thecouple's 3rd loan at Zene za Zene.

Azima wants to cultivate her land and given the increasing cost of fuel, needs this loan to buy fuel for her tractor and help run her business effectively. Depending on what she can afford, she may buy some additional chickens with any remaining funds.

loans.use: To buy fuel for  her tractor and to support her farm

loans.name: Assane Guisse

texts.fr:
Assane is an experience tailor. He is married and lives in the working-class district of Belfort. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs CFA in order to prepare for Korité (the holiday that follows the fasting of Ramadan) by buying a major stock of boutique items and fabrics.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Assane est un tailleur expérimenté. Il est marié et vit au populaire quartier de Belfort. Il sollicite un prêt de 300 000 F CFA afin de préparer la fête de la Korité en achetant un important stock de mercerie et de tissus.

loans.use: To sew clothing

loans.name: Mahliyo

texts.en:
Mahliyo G. is 27 years old, and is married with two children. Difficulty meeting the family's living expenses forced her husband to leave for Russia to earn more income. Mahliyo and her husband have to work a lot to provide their children with a good education.

A dedicated entrepreneur, Mahliyo runs her business day after day with a cheerful smile and a desire to meet the clothing needs of her customers. Currently she has a well-established clientele, which continues to grow. She is requesting a loan of 2750 Somoni (825 USD) to purchase more clothes to sell during the autumn season. The well-being of her family and her business are in your hands. Mahliyo and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchasing new women's and girls' clothing to sell

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing sells provisions and drinks. She started the business on her own in 2002. She had seen others selling provisions and took an interest. She thought it would be a good business that she could do with a little hard work.

She soon found that hard work was not all she needed, but also capital to purchase the provisions and drinks to have in stock. She turned to LAPO to help and has been borrowing and increasing her credit limit. She is hoping for a loan of US$ 350 from Kiva lenders to help her increase her inventory by purchasing more provisions and thus attract more customers. She says the additional profit will help her cater for her family. She is 38 years old and married with 6 children. Blessing says she will appreciate any assistance Kiva lenders are willing to give her.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Lort

texts.en: Mrs. Lort B. works raising pig. She has been raising them since 2000 and can earn $2.4 per day. She is married to Mr. Sory Som, 31, who has a rice mill for grinding rice as well as selling wood carvings, earning around $4 per day. Lort has two children and lives in Kroyea Commune, Kampong Thom Province. Lort needs a loan of $300 to purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise

loans.name: Melania

texts.es:
La Sra. Melania tiene 44 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Edgar Mungia, en la capital de Managua,  es casada, su esposo es pacificador lo cual entre ambos trabajan para desarrollar su negocio, tiene dos hijas de 
15 y 17 años de edad, que están cursando sus estudios, ellas también apoyan en el negocio de sus padres ya que es su fuente de ingresos, doña Melania lleva dos años en la elaboración de pan lo cual esta actividad se hace en la habitación de su casa, tiene mucha experiencia en el negocio ya que anteriormente vendía ropa, cosméticos y prendas de plata que ha la vez lo hace por encargo. Pues esta es su quinta solicitud en afodenic lo cual ha sido de mucho beneficios, por que ha podido mantener su negocio, con este préstamo va invertir en materia prima para desarrollar mejor su capital y sacar mas producción de pan en variedad. A largo plazo es poder ser una panadería de prestigio y distribuir sus productos de variedad, por todo el territorio.
texts.en:
Ms. Melania C. is a 44-year-old woman who lives in a neighborhood called Edgar Mungia, in the capital city of Managua. She is marred, and her husband is a pastor, so they both work to develop their business. She has two daughters, ages 15 and 17, who are currently studying. They, too, help out with their parents’ business because it is their source of income. Ms. C. has been making homemade bread for two years. She has plenty of experience in business because she used to sell clothing, cosmetics and silver jewelry by catalog. This is her fifth loan request with Afodenic, which has greatly benefited her in helping her maintain her business. She will invest this loan in the materials needed to further develop her capital and yield a greater variety of bread. Her long-term goal is to make her bakery a prestigious one and distribute her assorted breads throughout the entire country.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to increase bread production

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Trabaja de manera independiente en las ferias comerciales donde vende zapatos, esta actividad la inició hace más de 10 años, comenzó con poco capital, y ahora le es muy beneficioso, surgió con mucho empeño y supo salir adelante desde cero, además Edith ofrece su calzado a precios módicos, y en un futuro le gustaría tener una tienda de zapatos, por ahora sigue adelante con mucho ahínco por el bien de su familia. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, por lo que está comprometida a cumplir a cabalidad con sus cuotas de crédito. En esta ocasión, el dinero será invertido para incrementar su capital de trabajo, es decir sus zapatos, de esta manera abastecer las ventas para esta navidad
texts.en:
Edith is 31 years old, and she lives with her husband and their two children. She works independently at the commercial markets where she sells shoes. She began this activity more than 10 years ago, starting with little capital, and now it is very beneficial, it has surged forward due to her considerable efforts: she knew how to move forward having started with nothing. Also, Edith offers her shoes at moderate prices, and in the future she would like to have a shoe shop; for now she carries on eagerly for the sake of her family. It is the first time she has asked for a load with MFP, for which she is committed to completely fulfil her credit instalment obligations. This time, the money will be invested in order to increase her work capital, that is to say her shoes, as this will allow her to meet demand for this Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of shoes she sells

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 51-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon with his wife and their six children. Husein has been working as a farmer for eight years. He plants vegetables, green beans, nuts and peaches. Husein requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) in order to purchase pesticides and seeds for his land. This is the first time that Husein has requested a loan.

Husein is speciA. in his work because he has good quality vegetables. His clients are wholesalers. Husein decided to do this business because he inherited the land from his father and because he had learned the business since he was a kid. In the future, he plans to expand his farm.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides and seeds for his land.

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr: I. Aminatou a 43 ans et elle s’est mariée avec AKINDE Mohamed. Ils ont 5 enfants, Kabirou, Rachidath, Ramantou, Karim et Rachad, tous scolarisés. Depuis 15 ans elle fait la restauration. Sa spécialité est la vente de bouillie, une nourriture à base de farine de maïs. Les revenus de ses autres crédits l'ont aidé à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Dans l’avenir, Aminatou voudrait acheter toute sa marchandise en gros.
texts.en:
Aminatou I. is 43 years old and is married to Mohamed AKINDE. They have five school-attending children : Kabirou, Rachidath, Ramantou, Karim and Rachad. For 15 years, Mrs. I. has been working in the catering business. Her specialty is porridge made from cornmeal. The income she earned thanks to the previous loans helped her in providing for her family. In the future, Aminatou would like to buy all her supplies wholesale.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn for her catering business

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita A. is a rice farmer. She is 38 years old and has 4 children. Her husband is also a farmer. Together, they work together to support their children. Their harvest is mai ly, intended for family use. The remainders are sold to the rice traders in their village and the income is what she uses to buy their other needs. Aside from planting rice, they also grow vegetables on their farm. She waters them everyday and enjoy the harvest of her other crops.

She is asking a loan of Php 11,000. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. In this way, she will be able to increase her yield for her family.

She is one of the active CEVI clients. She has access to credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase Urea fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Narodje Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Narodje sont toutes mariées, avec en moyenne 37 ans et 3 enfants, elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Koumantou préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes sont partenaires de Soro Yiriwaso depuis un an et demi. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) et ont correctement remboursé les deux précédents prêts.
Le présent prêt est destiné à acheter, 100 kg de bananes et 150 kg de céréales (arachides, riz). Tandis que les vendeuses de bananes s’approvisionnent auprès des commerçants venant de Sikasso  les  jours de foire, les vendeuses de céréales achètent avec les agriculteurs des villages environnants.
De ces commerces les femmes du groupe Narodje espèrent avoir une marge bénéficiaire de 7.500 FCFA par mois. Cette somme leurs permettra de rembourser l’échéance du prêt et de satisfaire à quelques dépenses liées surtout aux enfants (éducation, santé, habillement).
texts.en:
The women of the Narodje group are all married, with an average age of 37 and on average, 3 children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Koumantou, Bougouni Prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women have been partners of Soro Yiriwaso for a year and a half. They are on their third solidarity loan (group loan) and have correctly reimbursed the two preceding loans.

This loan is intended to purchase 100 kg of bananas and 150 kg of cereals (peanuts and rice). Whereas the women selling bananas buy their goods from merchants coming from Sikasso on market days, the women selling cereals buy from the growers in surrounding villages.

From their sales, the women of the Narodje group hope to make a profit of 7,500 F CFA per month. This sum will allow them to make repayments on the loan and cover certain family expenses, especially relative to their children (education, health, and clothing).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Elisaphanie

texts.en:
Greetings from Elisaphanie M. in Kigali, Rwanda!  Elisaphanie has been selling shoes in Rwanda's capital city for ten years.  He is now requesting his first loan to help him expand the business.  The loan is worth 300,000 Rwandan Francs and he will pay it back on a monthly basis over an 8-month period.  

Elisaphanie has one employee and together they sell shoes from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm daily.  He is able to earn approximately 180,000 Rwandan Francs in profit each month (or $350 USD).  Married with 3 children, Elisaphanie is 31 years old.

loans.use: To buy more shoes

loans.name: Jene's Group

texts.en:
N. Jene is the leader of Atakola group in Jinja. She owns a pharmacy business since past 20 years. She is married with 5 children, all of whom attend school. She also looks after her extended family, including in laws, cousins and nieces. This is her third loan with the group, and she intends to buy more stock of medicines for her pharmacy. 

Jene also dreams of opening up branches of her shop which will be run by her other employees under her direct supervision. Due to the loans that she has been receiving in the past year-and-a-half, her medicine stock has increased. With this new loan too, Jene is going to buy more tablets, syringes, needles, anti malarial syrups and other drugs for her customers.

loans.use: Buying more stocks of medicines for her pharmacy

loans.name: Joeliz

texts.en:
Joeliz is from the village of San Fermin. She is 35 years old and single. She owns and operates a business operating a specialized retail store, primarily selling fruits and vegetables in the market.

Joeliz joined ASKI (Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc.) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.

Joeliz is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Joeliz from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

Joeliz diligently works at developing her business in order to support her family with their immediate needs, and also to support her younger brothers and sister in their education. She hopes to prosper in her vending business and become successful someday.


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Estanley Edgar

texts.en:
Estanley Edgar T. is 48 years old and has three children with his first wife. They are all living and working in Manila.  His second wife is Corazon, a widow with six children.  At the moment, Estanley lives with Corazon’s family and he is supporting the education of his stepchildren through his fish and farming business in their village at St. T. in Alicia, Isabela. He would like to borrow PHP 16,000 for his business. Aside from his fish and farming business, they are also engaged in a catering business that Corazon manages.  
He believes that there is no time in life that is a waste, “The only time we waste is the time we spend thinking that we are not worthy enough to do a task."

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy insecticide to protect her crop and fertilizer to improve yield

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en: M. was born in 1974 and is happily married with four children with two of them below 15 years of age, and all going to school. Being a very hardworking lady, she has faced some major challenges in life such as being a school dropout and having an inferiority complex because of a poor education standard. But she has gone on struggling to meet up with life against all these challenges. By so doing, she came to know of GHAPE in which she became a member in 2008, obtained a loan of 40,000 FRS, and repaid it successfully. Given her new loan, M. plans to buy rice, waterfufu (cassava dough), beans, vegetables, oil and seeds for farming. The loan repayment will start from the day of disbursement. She is sure the business will succeed because of the training being given to her by GHAPE. Furthermore she has been doing the business for a long period of time. Notwithstanding, she has a ready market for her goods and she is quite sure the business will succeed. Her community will benefit from her activity by having food at their disposal, reducing their distance to the market in order to get what she is selling. Due to the progress of the business, M. plans to use the profit from the business to pay for her children’s school fees, to expand the business and to feed the family. She prefers loans from GHAPE because GHAPE is trustworthy, the method of repayment is convenient, and GHAPE usually educates before giving out the loan. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy rice, waterfufu, beans, vegetables, oil and seeds for farming

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience, 43 years old and married with four children, sells provisions and drinks. At present she is requesting the loan amount of N60000 to purchase a grinding machine, provisions and foodstuffs.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding machine, provisions and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en:
Mrs. Sareth V. lives in the village of Pam in the province of Takeo. She is a farmer in the local village. Aside from this plantation, she is a pig breeder.

For the first plantation, she now faces a small problem because the soil in her field has become infertile. She decided to ask for a loan in order to buy more fertilizers to support the field so as to make her crop more productive. She plans to use the rest of the loan to buy more piglets and pig food to support her second business.

Mrs. Sareth V. is 42 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Bin Munyra, is a village chief who earns a small salary to support the family. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to support the field

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel R. is 35 years old and married with teenage kids. She lives in San Agustin St., Brgy. 1, La Carlota, Negros Occidental.

When she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002, she'd already been in the food-vending business for two years, but the PHP 3,000 she borrowed for her first loan went a long way in allowing her to increase her income capacity.

From her own efforts and with the help of the loans she got from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Liezel was able to have her house repaired and she was also able to buy a motorcycle that they use to deliver her food products. 

This is already Liezel's 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon and she intends to borrow PHP 19,500 as additional capital so that she can increase the volume of the delicacies that she sells.

Because her kids are approaching college age, Liezel is working extra to earn more so that she can save up for the education of her children while continuing to help her husband support their growing family.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her food-vending business

loans.name: Edward's Group

texts.en:
S. Edward is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is 54 years old and married with 10 children aged 28 – 3 years, and he takes care of one orphan.  Edward is a farmer, and at the same time lays bricks for building houses. 

In the farming business, he has been involved in poultry for 30 years and he also keeps cattle.  His main challenge is the seasonality of his business and the lack of accessibility to the big markets.  However, he is able to make 140,000/= as weekly profits and these are and have been helpful in looking after his family. Edward’s main key to success is the fact that he has high quality products.  

His goal is to expand his businesses further by having more birds and cows for fattening. For the bricks, he employs men to help him lay the bricks.  He needs a loan to help employ men to mingle the soil for brick laying as well as buy pesticides for his farm.

loans.use: Employing labor to mingle soil for brick laying and pesticides for farming.

loans.name: Hamze

texts.en: Hamze is a 20-year-old single man living with his parents. He has a clothing shop and he is the one who supports his family with this business. He has been involved in this business for three years. In order to increase his sales and his income, Hamze is requesting to borrow $700 to purchase additional merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La señora Maria Cristina S. Jiménez tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos todos menores de edad a su cargo. Dos de sus hijos están en escuelas de primaria, mientras su esposo labora como conductor de un microbús. Maria tiene un negocio de venta de queso y frutas, el cual está ubicado contiguo al mercado. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a la venta de queso, sin embargo fue hasta hace dos años que la señora decidió invertir en la compra de frutas y verduras para vender en su tramo, buscando de esta manera como incrementar sus ingresos. Ella lo empezó con un primo de su actual esposo, el cual también invirtió capital en la apertura del mismo. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mas mercadería que le permitirá incrementar sus ventas y de esta manera su ganancia. Últimamente han tenido muchos problemas relacionados con la inestabilidad en el precio del producto, y es por ello que necesitan financiamiento para cubrir cualquiera de estos problemas. Su sueño siempre ha sido agrandar más su negocio para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Cristina S. Jiménez is 39 years old, is married, and has three young children. Two of her children are in primary school, and her husband works as a microbus driver. Maria has a business located next to the market where she sells cheese and fruits. She has sold cheese for more than 8 years, but it was not until 2 years ago that she decided to invest in the purchase of fruit and vegetables to sell in her space. She did this hoping to increase her income. She started this business with her husband's cousin, who invested capital. The loan will be invested in the purchase of more produce which will allow her to increase sales and thus her profits. Lately they have had problems because of the price instability of the products, and the financing will help handle those problems. Her dream has always been to grow her business in order to offer a better quality of life for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of produce and dairy products

loans.name: Navkiron

texts.en:
U. Navkiron has a great passion for dairy farming and has been in this business for eight years. He is 28 years old and married with two children. Navkiron would like to expand his business by adding additional cows to the ones he has. This is because he recently acquired out-of-town orders to supply milk. Navkiron is requesting a loan of 5000 somoni in order to buy another cow and feed. With additional income, Navkiron will be better able to meet his family's financial obligations and, especially, to provide for the education of his children.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchasing cattle

loans.name: Sorry Heart Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Sorry Heart Group. They are small-scale businesspeople in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of SLL 2,500,000 (or SLL 500,000 for each) to enable them to improve their businesses. With a loan, they will be able to add more goods into their stalls, make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standard will improve so that they can better look after themselves and their children. 

The leader of this group is Isatu S. (on the left). She was born in Magburaka about 37 years ago. Her husband works at the Government hospital and her three children are in Junior Secondary School and primary school, respectively. Isatu sells local produce like pepper, onion, margi (used in sauce to give a sweet taste), fish, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) etc. She has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. She will use this loan to increase the size of her business. Isatu enjoys selling these goods and finds it very difficult to change, as she is already well known for this type of business.

loans.use: To buy gallons of palm oil, packets of margi, bags of onions

loans.name: Cheri Mai

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheri Mai M. lives in a nuclear family in Thecho with her husband, son, and daughter. Thecho is located in the Lalitpur District. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Cheri's husband, Mr. Hari Gopal M., is a farmer. He works his own land. Both her son and daughter are at university.

Mrs. M. opened up her own tailoring shop 3 year ago. She prefers to make custom-fitted ladies' clothes like "kurta-salwar", blouses and other varieties of ladies' dresses in her shop. She took tailoring training from a local tailoring shop. Now she is asking for her third loan from Kiva of Rs 30,000 to buy raw materials such as cloth, thread, etc. for her tailoring work. She repaid her first Kiva loan in Oct 08.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen S., 59, is a widow and resides in Phnom Penh City with one of her children. To make a living, she is involved in a business of producing Cambodian traditional cakes, earning an income of US $3 per day. The family is also assisted by one of her children who is a skillful tailor, earning an income of US $2 per day. These sources of incomes help cover the family expenses. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $300 to purchase more ingredients to expand her cake production for her existing customers.

loans.use: buy more ingredients to expand the cake production

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres Solidarias (Women in Solidarity). Her story is representative of her group, as well as of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a northern city dependent on tourism for its economy and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple set-up with her long term partner and their child.

Maria is excited to be taking her second loan from Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing and vegetables by purchasing two dozen pairs of panties, pants and two dozen t-shirts as well as three dozen vegetables. She will use the profits to invest in notebooks and books for her child. In the long term she hopes to buy a house with the earnings from her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 25-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Ali has been working as a house painter. He decided on this work because of his experience. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties except for making himself known to the public. Now, his clients are people from his region. Ali’s work is special because he does it well and is aware of the new painting fashions.

Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase paint and tools for his work. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. He needs new tools so that he can do his best work. He hopes to continue improving his business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase paint and tools for his house painting business.

loans.name: Junushalieva Gulzat's Group

texts.ru:
Гулзат является лидером этой группы. Ей 38 лет, она замужем и воспитывает 4 сыновей. Супруг работает водителем, сама же занимается  животноводством. В данное время у нее в хозяйстве имеются на откорм 3 головы КРС, которые весной будут реализованы. Наш кредит позволит ей приобрести для дальнейшего откорма 4 головы МРС. В этом бизнесе она уже на протяжении последних 16 лет, ежемесячный доход составляет около 150 долларов.  В следующем году второй сын поступит  в ВУЗ, и семья клиента копит сбережения для оплаты учебы сына.

Рысбеку 42 года, он женат, а также является отцом 2 детей. Сам клиент занимается откормом и реализацией скота в Кочкорке, а у супруги имеется свой собственный бизнес по продаже муки. Животноводством занимается с 1996 года. Именно за счет доход от животноводства  купили контейнер для реализации муки и таким образом увеличили семейный доход. 

Салтанат 38 лет. Она также замужем, имеет 3 сыновей. Супруг является членом фермерского хозяйства. Кредит будет использован для увеличения поголовья скота, в данное время она откармливает двух бычков. За счет бизнеса в прошлому году они смогли построить себе 3 комнатный жилой дом.

Жаныл замужем, ей 41 лет. Она воспитывает 4 детей: два сына и две дочери. Она вместе с супругом занимаются животноводством. Бизнес был начат сравнительно недавно, а именно в начале 2009 года. Начальный капитал был равен 200 долларам, в данное время ее капитал равен примерно 2 000 долларам. Как видно это очень эффективный бизнес. Кредит позволит ей купить 2 овец для откорма. 


This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Gulzat is the leader of this group. She is 38 years old, married and is raising 4 sons. Her husband works as a driver, and Gulzat is involved in animal husbandry. Currently, she has three heads of cattle to be fed and sold in the spring. Our loan will allow her to obtain 4 heads of small livestock for further feeding. Gulzat has been in this business for the last 16 years. Her monthly income is about 150 dollars. Her son will start a university next year, and the family is saving money to pay for the son’s education. Rysbek is 42 years old. He is married and is a father of 2 children. The client is involved in raising and selling livestock in Kochkor, and his wife has her own flour sales business. Rysbek has been involved in animal husbandry since 1996. They were able to purchase a container for selling flour precisely from the income from his business and, thus, increased the family’s overall income. Saltanat is 38 years old. She is also married and has 3 sons. Her husband is a member of a farmer enterprise. This loan will be used for increasing livestock headcount. Currently, Saltanat is raising two bulls. Last year, Saltanat and her husband were able to build a three-bedroom house for themselves due to the income from the business. Janyl is married. She is 41 years old. She is raising 4 children: two sons and two daughters. Janyl and her husband are involved in animal husbandry. They started the business relatively recently, precisely at the beginning of 2009. Their starting capital was 200 dollars, and the current capital is about 2000 dollars. As you can see, this is a very effective business. This loan will allow Janyl to purchase 2 sheep to feed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 4 sheep

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.en:
Silvestra R. P. has been selling fruits and vegetables in the Masaya Market for ten years.  She needs this loan because her business is growing.  Silvestra will use the loan to buy tamarind, avacado, oranges, plums and other fruits in season.

Silvestra has participated in ADIM’s personal and business development program; it teaches women how to recognize and improve self-esteem, manage their small business efficiently, and empower individuals. She said the program has really helped with the performance of her business , her perception of herself, and her personal relationships.

loans.use: To buy fruits in season

loans.name: Mbène

texts.fr: Mbène GUEYE est une veuve de 40 ans, avec en charge 4 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de poissons fumés et séchés et de céréales telles que mil et arachide. Ce commerce lui permet de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mbène G. is a 40-year-old widow and cares for her four children. She sells smoked and dried fish as well as cereals, such as millet and peanuts. This business enables her to better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dried and smoked fish as well as cereals

loans.name: Celinda Victoria

texts.es:
Celinda tiene 62 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus hermanos y una sobrina en el distrito de Zaña, una zona ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Por más de 30 años se ha dedicado a la preparación y venta de dulces típicos y gracias a este negocio ha podido salir adelante. Ella prepara diversos dulces típicos como turrones de ajonjolí,jaleas, chocotejas y conserva de frutas para venderlos en su establecimiento a los turistas que visitan la zona para observar algunas ruinas coloniales. El negocio es su unica fuente de ingreso por lo que ella trata de dar lo mejor de si para seguir adelante.

Celinda desea ampliar su negocio y empezar a distribuir los productos en otros establecimientos de la zona, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de insumos para preparar mas dulces y asi lograr su objetivo.

Celinda es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que gusta mucho del trabajo que realiza. Sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona honrada y de confianza.
texts.en:
Celinda, age 62, is single and lives with her brothers and a niece in the Zaña district, an area located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 30 years she has been involved in the preparation and sale of traditional candies, and, thanks to this business, she has been able to get ahead.
